loans.name: Nicasio Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nicasio Edgar; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor nombrado, el socio también dicta clases particulares a diferentes alumnos, el socio quiere seguir mejorando como profesor y así de esta manera brindarles una mejor enseñanza a sus alumnos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco province and department. 

The member’s name is Mr. Nicasio Edgar. He is 50 years old and married. He has four children. He is a teacher and he also offers tutoring sessions to students. He wants to continue improving as a teacher, so he can offer his students the best education he can.  Nicasio Edgar is requesting the loan for personal use.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: for personal use

loans.name: Efrain Ponciano

texts.es:
Efraín, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos (los dos menores de edad), quienes son su motivación de seguir trabajando, vive en la Zona de La Flor, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Efraín trabaja para poder solventar los gastos familiares. Lleva 2 años estudiando en el Instituto CAPECO, la carrera de Técnico en Construcción Civil. 
Una de sus metas es poder terminar su carrera y que sus hijos estén orgullosos de él. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea pagar la matrícula y sus pensiones.
texts.en:
Efraín, is a hard-working, tenacious, 37 year old man. He is married with two young children, who are his motivation to continue working. He lives in Zona de La Flor in the Carabayllo district.
Efraín works so that he can meet his family's living costs. He has been studying for two years at the CAPECO Institute, on a Civil Engineering Technician course.
One of his goals is to be able to finish his course and that doing so will make his sons proud of him.
He wishes to use the requested loan to pay his registration fees and his lodgings.

loans.use: To pay registration fees and lodgings

loans.name: Formidables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORMIDABLES” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, será parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, es un grupo muy entusiasta.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, 9 mujeres y 1 varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de péliculas en DVD`s, venta de juguetes, librería, tienda de abarrotes, venta de electrodomésticos,servicio de enfermería.

La asociación cuenta con una mesa directiva que esta compuesta por una presidenta la señora Lucia, una tesorera la señora Rosario y la señora María del Carmen como secretaria de actas. 

La señora Lucia, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que vive con su pareja y que es  madre de tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de videos desde hace mas de seis anos.  Las ventas son realizadas en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, el Zona de Rio Seco y la Zona de 16 de Julio, cinco dias a la semana, trabaja de manera ambulante.

El crédito que ha solicitado la señora Lucía le permitirá comprar mercaderia.

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es la oportunidad de compartir con su grupo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “FORMIDABLES” Communal Bank will begin its first round in Pro Mujer, it will be part of Focal de Los Andes Centre, and it is a very enthusiastic group. It is comprised of 9 women and 1 man. The businesses that they run are diverse, among them: movie DVD sales, toy sales, book sales, a grocery store, domestic electrical goods sales and a nursing service.

The Bank has a board of directors that is comprised of their President, Lucia, their Treasurer, Rosario and Sra María del Carmen as Secretary.

Lucia, the president of the communal bank, reports that she lives with her partner and is a mother to three children. For just over the last six months her business has involved selling videos. She sells her wares 5 days a week by peddling at fairs in El Alto city, Zona de Rio Seco and Zona de 16 de Julio,  

Lucia's requested loan will allow her to purchase merchandise.

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies the opportunity to share with her group and the savings.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benson Amadu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Badru Deen Secondary School, Kenema. This school was founded in September 2000 by the Badru Deen Islamic Organization to promote education in the country. Badru Deen Secondary school is staffed with thirty able teachers and has 695 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Benson A. M. is the leader of this group of teachers. The thirty-seven-year-old Benson was born in Ngiehun village. He has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. He is married to a housewife and they have one child who is attending primary school. Benson has requested this loan in order to purchase house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia tiene 35 años, está casada con el Sr. Victor Ferreira, tienen dos hijos mayores y una menor de edad. Ella trabajaba en una casa de familia, hasta que logró dar apertura a su despensa en su propia casa; mientras que don Victor trabaja en una empresa envasadora de alimentos.
Su despensa la inició en el año 2009, con unos modestos estantes y productos de primera necesidad para la venta.
Hoy, doña Cecilia también está vendiendo helados, bebidas y numerosos productos para el hogar, así como también minutas.
La Sra. Cecilia necesita de este crédito para la adquisición de gaseosas, jugos, helados y otros tipos de bebidas, además de frutas para la elaboración de ensaladas de frutas, pues como es temporada de verano estos son los productos mas requeridos.
Su anhelo es poder concluir la construcción de su modesta vivienda así como también poder cubrir el costo de los estudios de su hija menor el mayor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia is 35 years old and married to Mr. Victor Ferreira. They have two grown children and one young daughter. Cecilia used to work in another family's home, until she was able to open a store in her own house. Meanwhile, Victor works at a food packaging company.

Cecilia started her store in 2009, with modest shelves stocked with staple items for sale. Today, she also sells frozen desserts, drinks, a variety of products for the home, and snacks. Cecilia needs this loan to purchase soft drinks, juices, and other beverages, frozen desserts, and fruit for preparing fruit salads. Since it is now summertime, these are the products most in demand.

Her dream is to be able to finish the construction of her modest home and to be able to cover the cost of her youngest daughter's education for as long as possible

loans.use: to buy sodas, frozen desserts, candies, bulk products, and other items

loans.name: Epimaque

texts.en:
Epimaque is 40 years old and is married with four children  between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. Epimaque is known in the business of selling a variety of clothes, mainly jeans, and this is his eighteenth successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 6am until 6pm every day.

Epimaque has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by adding a variety of styles such as jeans,shirts and some other attractive styles. With this additional business, Epimaque will hopefully earn more profit than in his previous business. One portion of the profit will be used to build a secure future for his future family. The other portion of his profit will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes especially jeans for sale

loans.name: Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Saidati is 26 years old, married with two children. Saidati is the president of a group called 'Twegerane'. She is wearing the red shirt in her group.  This group owns a restaurant where they sell food in order to earn their daily living. This group has been in this business for about 3 years and the hours of the business are from 5am until 10pm every day.

Saidati and her group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this group will purchase equipment and increase the quantity of food which in turn will increase profits. With these profits, the members of this group will pay school fees for their children and continue taking care of their families. In addition, they will keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: Additional equipment and food for the restaurant

loans.name: Rafaela Vanessa

texts.es: Rafaela Vanessa tiene 51 años, su actividad es la venta de leña ella se levanta muy temprano, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar este producto que es muy necesario. La mayoría de personas le llegan a dejar este producto que a diario ofrece. Se siente muy contenta pues este el primer crédito que realiza y se siente satisfecha de poder contar con esta ayuda para su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de mayor cantidad de leña. El deseo de seguir siempre con su negocio y  pagar todas sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rafaela Vanessa, 51, sells firewood.  She rises very early because her customers come by always seeking this product which is very necessary.  Most of the people come by for this product which she sells daily.

She feels happy because this is the first loan she’s taken out and she feels satisfied that she can count on this help for her business.

The loan she’s asking for will be used to buy larger amounts of firewood.  Her wish is to stay in business always and make all of her payments.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Kanguka Ukore Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 47 years old, a widow with one child, who is 4 years old.  Jeanne is the only working member of this family.  She has to work hard to provide everything necessary for her family.

Jeanne is a businesswoman selling fruit and cakes and this business is fruitful for her. Jeanne is also the leader of this group which is called Kanguka ukore. The group contains seven women and six men; most of whom are in the business of selling food products.

Jeanne and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest  in expanding her business.

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: Petrona tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de quesillos, hace más de 4 años  que tiene este negocio, pues todos los días de semana tiene que salir a los colegios para vender sus productos. Ella siempre está pendiente de sus 2 hijos menores de edad que son muy importantes, es por eso que se esfuerza por mantener este negocio que es el que le genera ganancias a su hogar. El crédito es para la compra de tortillas, quesillos, bolsas, servilletas entre otras cosas. El sueño de Petrona es heredarles el negocio a sus hijos para que tenga un medio de supervivencia.
texts.en:
Petrona, 27, sells cheese.  She’s had this business for over 4 years.  She goes out every day of the week to sell at schools.  She is always watchful of her two small children who are very important to her.  Because of this she strives to keep the business which is what generates income for her home.

She will use the loan to buy tortillas, cheese, bags and napkins, among others.  Petrona’s dream is to leave the business to her children so that they will have a means of supporting themselves.

loans.use: To buy tortillas, cheese, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres Independientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Independientes es de la zona de San Lorenzo.
Ya son reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en pos del bienestar de la comunidad.
Varias señoras son trabajadoras de sus propias huertas, como por ejemplo la sra Fifelina L., que también ella misma vende sus productos agrícolas una vez cultivados y cosechados, tiene todas las verduras más consumidas.
Es el primer crédito de sus vidas y lo están pagando puntualmente, ya que de lunes a viernes cultivan y fines de semana se van al mercado para las ventas de sus Hortalizas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Independientes” (Independent Women) committee is from the San Lorenzo zone.  They are already well known because of the work they do for their community’s wellbeing.

Several of the women work their own orchards like, for example, Mrs. Fifelina L., who also sells her farm products, once they are grown and harvested, herself.  She has all the most frequently consumed vegetables.

This is the first loan of their lives and they are repaying punctually.  From Monday through Friday they farm and on weekends they go to the market to sell their vegetables.

loans.use: To buy seed, insecticide, half shades, sprinklers, hoses, etc.

loans.name: Yelba Mabel

texts.es:
DESCRIPCION: Yelba de 24 años de edad, Labora como secretaria en el Instituto Ruben Dario desde hace 5 años , tiene 2 niñas, su compañero de vida labora como docente de primaria él tambien se desempeña como docente universitario en la Universidad URACCAN el cual ayudara con el pago de sus cuotas ya que son una familia bien unida.  

Solicita su segundo crèdito a la Instituciòn mediante Kiva para  ponerle el  piso a su vivienda y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia,  segun referencias es bien responsables con sus compromisos.  

Su sueño es que sus hijas crezcan sanas y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Yelba is 24 years old and has worked as a secretary for the Ruben Dario Institute for five years. She has two daughters. Her partner in life works as an elementary school teacher, but is also a college instructor at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast (URACCAN). Their incomes help with the loan payments since they are a close family.

Yelba is requesting a Kiva loan, her second with AFODENIC, so that she can install a floor in her home. This will improve her living conditions, as well as those of her family. According to her references, Yelba is very responsible with her commitments.

Her dream is for her daughters to grow up healthy and to see her family remain together.

loans.use: Install a floor in her home

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou N. est âgé  de 39 ans .Il est marié et s'active dans la vente de matériaux de quincaillerie (boulon ,vice)il bénéficie de plusieurs années d'expériences dans ce secteur. Il collabore avec un magasin à Mbour qui lui fournis de la marchandise et lui disposant de sa propre voiture livre la marchandise directement à ses clients ce qui élimine d'office la concurrence car souvent le client achète et supporte les frais de transport. C'est une activité très rentable et qui lui permet de payer sans difficultés aucune
texts.en: Mamadou N. is 39 years old. He is married and works selling hardware items . He has (bolts, nuts). He has many years of experience in this sector. He collaborates with a store in Mbour where he gets his merchandise. Having his own car, he delivers the merchandise directly to clients, which gives him a competitive edge, since   clients often pay for  goods and delivery. This is a very profitable activity, which allows him to repay his loans without any difficulty.

loans.use: Retail

loans.name: C 2169 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Christine, 41 years old, is a widow without children. She is the representative of a group called Umucyo.  This group has two men and three women.

Christine owns a small shop which sells green bananas.  She has been in the business for three years and employs one person as a helper, so that her business runs smoothly. Her business starts at 6am and runs until 6pm every day.

Christine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to invest in their businesses.  They hope to expand their businesses and earn more profits, so they are able to save money for their families.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
Don Rafael Angel de 41 años de edad, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 4 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, labora para el ceta Inatec,  su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos ya que son una familia bien humilde y uinda.   

Solicita su tercer credito para construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones y asi gozar de privacidad ya que solamente cuentan con una habitaciòn en su casita, 

su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de mucha salud y  poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Don Rafael Angel is 41 years old and has worked as a security guard at the National Institute of Technology (INATEC) for four years. He works with great responsibility and honesty. His wife is in charge of the household duties and caring for their children. His humble family is very close.

He is requesting his third loan so that he can build a room with better conditions. His family will be able to enjoy privacy since their house only has one room. Rafael’s greatest dream is for his family to enjoy good health and to gradually improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: C 2387 Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Fresixan is a hardworking 31-year-old man. He is married and has a two year-old child. He runs a well-organized small shop, which sells various products and employs seven people.  He got into this business because it is profitable in his region, and has been operating it successfully for four years.  His shop is open from 7am until 5pm every day. 

Fresixan is the leader of a group called "Jyambere" in the local language. The group includes five members (four men and one woman) and five businesses, including a spare parts business and a business selling cakes.  The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their shops so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they all earn, Fresixan and his group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintain a room & add a closet

loans.name: Serafín

texts.es:
El sr. Serafín  está casado con la sra. Amelia Bogado, tienen 6 hijas, 5 mayores y una en edad escolar, se dedica a la carpintería y fabricación de muebles rústicos, este oficio lo aprendió en una empresa grande que se dedica al mismo rubro, pero ahora tiene su negocio en su domicilio.
El crédito será de gran ayuda para la compra de más madera, ya que tiene mucha cantidad de pedidos.
Don S. desea comprar un vehículo y transportar en él su mercadería.
texts.en:
Serafín is married to Mrs. Amelia Bogado.  They have six daughters, five adults and one who is school age.   He is a carpenter and makes rustic furniture.  He leaned this skill while working at a large firm engaged in the same line of work.  Now, however, he has his business at home.

The loan will be of great help to buy more lumber because he has quite a few pending orders.

Mr. S. wants to buy a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: C 5601 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking 62 years old woman with four children aged between 14 and 34. She is pictured above on the right wearing the blue and green dress. For six years she has owned a small shop which sells various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on. Her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day. 

Josephine and her business are well known in the region, which is the reason why she is the leader of the group called “Tuzamurane” in the local language. She and her group, which consists of four women and two men, have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for their businesses. Josephine especially needs this loan in order to expand her product offering and satisfy the demands of her customers.  If this satisfaction is reached, Josephine and the other group members hope to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her shop and expand her business

loans.name: Rosa Consuelo

texts.es:
Rosa Consuelo, nacio en el Dpto. de la Libertad, tiene 28 años de edad, soltera, vive en la Zona de los Ángeles de Naranjal, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Hace dos años trabaja como Profesora de Educación Inicial,en el Colegio I.E.P “Horacio Patiño Crusatti” en el distrito de Surco. 
Desde muy joven ha sido trabajadora, ayudando a su padres en los gastos del hogar.
Una de sus metas a lograr es tener su doctorado.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea pagar el grado de Bachiller, la inscripción para su Maestría en la Universidad Cesar Vallejo y mensualidades.
texts.en:
Rosa Consuelo was born in La Libertad department.  She is 28 years old, single and lives in the Ángeles de Naranjal zone, Carabayllo district.

For the last two years she has worked as an Elementary School Teacher at the “Horacio Patiño Crusatti” School in Surco district.

She has worked since she was very young helping her parents meet household expenses.

One of the goals is to get a Doctorate.

With the requested loan she wants to pay for her Bachelor’s Degree, her enrollment fee for her Master’s Degree at Cesar Vallejo University and monthly tuition.

loans.use: To pay for various educational expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: C2883 Tujyinama Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 40 years old and is married with three children aged between 5 and 17. In this family, only Emmanuel works and so he has to work hard so that he provides everything necessary for his family.

Emmanuel is a businessman selling fruit and cakes and this business is fruitful for him. Emmanuel is the leader of this group which is called Tujyinama The group contains two women and one man. He is on the left side, most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs. Emmanuel and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business.

loans.name: C 2388 Abafatanyije Group

texts.en:
Collette, a 40-year-old mother of seven children between 9 and 18 years of age, owns a small shop which sells fruit and vegetables. Her business, well known in the region, is the reason she is the leader of this group, called Abifatanyije in the local language.

Collette, who has been in her business for a year, describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her shop is open daily from 6 am until 6 pm.

Collette and her group have requested this loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products for their businesses. Collette especially needs this loan in order to expand her enterprise through the purchase of more fruit and vegetables, a purchase that will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. With the additional profits, she expects to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto es acompañado tiene 6 persona a su cargo y labora como fontanero de sistema, este crédito lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción para hacer anexo de cuarto para casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Humberto has a life partner and six people in his care.  He works as a plumber.

He is requesting a loan to buy building materials and supplies to add a room to his house.

loans.use: For housing improvements.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El sr. Jorge es soltero, vive con sus padres, él tiene una despensa hace 8 años en su domicilio, en la cuidad de San Lorenzo, se inició en este rubro con sus padres ya que tienen un negocio en el mercado municipal de su ciudad.
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de más mercaderías, como útiles escolares, ya que se está iniciando el año lectivo.
Jorge desea ampliar su negocio y dar fuente de trabajo a las personas de su cuidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is single living with his parents.  He’s had a general store in his house in San Lorenzo for the last 8 years.  He started in this line of work with his parents since they have a business in the city’s municipal market.

The loan will help him buy more merchandise, like school supplies, since the school term is starting.

Jorge wants to expand his business to provide employment to people in his city.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Ange Obed

texts.es:
Angel  de 32 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo menor de edad  estudiandia su primaria quien esta al cuidado de la abuelita; Don Angel labora para el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan desde hace un año como Guarda de seguridad,  ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, desempeñando su trabajo con eficiencia y dedicacion, ha superado los obstaculos de la vida con sacrificio de modo que se esmera para que a su familia no le falte el pan de cada dia.  

Necesita este financiamiento con el apoyo de Kiva para reparar el techo y asi brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y  mejores condiciones de vida. 

Su sueño es darle una excelente educacion a su hijo y tener un trabajo digno para darle lo mejor a su Familia.
texts.en:
Angel, age 32, has one young child in elementary school who is cared for by his grandmother. Angel has worked for the Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan [company] for one year as a security guard. He has proven himself to be a responsible person who does his work with efficiency and dedication. He has overcome the obstacles of life with sacrifice, and he has worked very hard so that his family does not lack their daily bread.

He needs this loan, with Kiva's support, to repair the roof of his home in order to offer his family greater security and better living conditions.

His dream is to give his child an excellent education, and to have decent work so that he can give his family the best.

loans.use: Repairing the roof of his house

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.es:
Josefina pertenece al grupo Las Reinas 1, un grupo formado por 5 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, ya sean con negocios establecidos en sus propias viviendas y/o locales,  o D. manera ambulante. Se dedican mayormente a L. venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Josefina posee una familia conformada por su 2 hijos y su madre. En una vivienda construida en una estructura simple D. madera. Sus desafíos más difíciles han sido educar a sus hijos y proveer sus necesidades, tambien enfrentarse a diversas enfermedades sin tener el dinero ni servicios suficientes para salir adelante, antes cualquier dificultad. 

El negocio D. Josefina es L. ventas D. Casabe, alimento producido con yuca y otros condimentos, lleva alrededor D. 2 años, después D. haber tomado su primer préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, y nos cuenta que inicio gracias a que algunas D. sus vecinas conocieron el programa D. microcredito y L. invitaron a participar. Josefina ha tomado ya 4 prestamos con Esperanza Internacional, y se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. paquetes D. casabe al por mayor, para luego ser vendido como minorista. 

Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona D. pocos recursos D. L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, específicamente ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the 'Las Reinas 1' (The Queens 1) group which has five members.  Each member works in their own business in the city of Santo Domingo.  Some of these are established businesses located in the member's own home and / or business premises, whilst others are street vendors with no fixed sales location.  They mainly sell clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food products and other miscellaneous products.

Josefina's family consists of herself, her two children and her mother.  They live in a simple home which is built from wood.  Josefina's biggest challenges have been educating her children and providing for their needs.  She has also had to face a number of illnesses without having enough  money or services to get ahead when faced with such difficulties.

Josefina's business is selling 'casabe' (cassava bread) which is produced with cassava and other seasonings.  She has been in this business for around 2 years and started after taking her first loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She tells us that she started out in her business because some of her neighbors were familiar with the micro-credit program and invited her to take part.  Josefina has already had 4 loans from Esperanza Internacional and she feels very grateful because the loans have enabled her to make progress and invest in her business.  She will invest this new loan in buying packets of cassava bread wholesale which she will then sell as a retailer.

Josefina's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who have mostly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities.  This area, like many poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks reliable drinking water and electricity.  This group is located in a poor area of the city of Santo Domingo, in the north of the city.

loans.use: To buy several packets of 'casabe' (cassava bread)

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: El Sr .José Daniel labora como fontanero en la sección de corte y conexión  tiene tres hijo es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga ella se siente contenta por la oportunidad brindada ya que con este desembolso lograra comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en su vivienda.
texts.en: José Daniel works as a Plumber in the cut and connection section.   He has three children and this is his first Ceprodel loan.  He is happy for the opportunity this disbursement provides for he will buy building materials and supplies to add a room to his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro Enrique

texts.es: El Sr .Alejandro labora como fontanero de sistema de agua tiene cinco hijo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga el sr. siente que es un gran apoyo lo que está haciendo esta institución con este  desembolso para lograra comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anselmo works as a plumber.  He has five children.  This is the first loan CEPRODEL has granted.

He feels that what the institution is doing is a great help.

He will use this disbursement to buy building materials and supplies to add a room to his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juana Regina

texts.es:
La señora Juana O. tiene 44 años y su pareja es el Sr. Silvino Alvarenga, quien  trabaja en las huertas cultivando y cosechando hortalizas como cebollita de verdeo, poroto manteca, choclo, locote, cebolla de cabeza y lechuga.
Ellos tienen su huerta en San Lorenzo, ella se encarga de las ventas de todos estos productos de Siembra, es quien por la mañana temprano trabaja hasta que venda todos sus productos.
En la casa viven dos de sus hijos, quienes trabajan en forma dependiente y colaboran con los gastos de la casa pagando sus estudios.
Con este crédito piensan comprar algunos elementos de trabajo como manguera para el riego, semillas, abono y pagos del personal que cobra por día.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana O. is 44 years old. Her husband is Sr. Silvino Alvarenga, who works in a garden growing and harvesting vegetables such as green onions, butter beans, corn, peppers, onions, and lettuce. Their garden is in San Lorenzo. Juana is responsible for selling all of the products they grow. She starts working early in the morning until all of her products are sold. Juana lives with two of her children who work independently, contribute toward the household expenses, and pay for their studies.

With this loan, Juana plans to buy a few supplies for her work such as tubing for irrigation, seeds, compost. She will also pay the daily wages of her workers.

loans.use: Purchase tubing for irrigation, seeds, compost; pay wages of her workers

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Armando  labora como Operador de pozo y es soltero tiene dos personas a su cargo es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga, para compra de materiales de construcción para mejora de su vivienda como: cemento, arena, hierro y zinc para la construcción de un cuarto para su casa de habitación..
Agradece a CEPRODEL  por su apoyo.
texts.en: Armando works as a well operator.  He is single and has two people for whom he is responsible.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL and the funds will be used to buy construction materials for home improvements such as cement, sand, iron, and zinc.  Armando plans to build a room in his house.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta B. está casada con el Sr. Amancio Gómez, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores.
Ella posee una  despensa en su  domicilio, trabajó desde muy pequeña con su madre, de quien heredó el negocio, mientras que el Sr. Amancio es constructor de obras; con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su cónyuge logró sacar adelante a su familia.
Ellos  necesitan de este crédito para la compra de mercaderías  para la despensa y también útiles escolares.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio  y dar fuente de trabajo en su barrio .
texts.en:
Sra. Marta B. is married to Sr. Amancio Gómez. They have three grown children.

She operates a food pantry out of her home. Marta worked with her mother from a young age and then inherited the business from her. Sr. Amancio works in construction. With great effort and the help of her husband, Marta’s family is able to move forward. She needs a loan to buy merchandise for her food pantry as well as school supplies. Her dream is to expand her business and provide employment in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, noodles, rice, oil, and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for replacing a wall in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for building a wall

loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Lucía nació hace más de 5 años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, en estos cinco años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La sra. Mirian F. es la presidenta del grupo, ella posee su propio almacén, para poder obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. Por eso solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, fideos, leche, carne, frutas, verduras, y también jabones y artículos de limpieza.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Committee was established five years ago with the help of another committee that was working in the area.  

After five years of hard work, this committee from San Lorenzo has grown both socially and economically.  The group is known locally for its hardworking women.  Sra. Mirian F. is the group president.  She has a grocery store as her small business so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soaps, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, oranges, tomatoes, onions, nail polishes, beverages, and other items

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 1, 2 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Raysa (parada con Blusa azul) es una joven empresaria D. apenas 23 años, una familia conformada por sus padres y algunos D. su hermanos. En una vivienda  propia construida en una estructura simple, techada D. zinc y paredes D. block. Sus planes son seguir esforzándose mientras trabaja desea terminar sus estudios universitarios y así poder formar una familia y ayudar a sus padres en sus necesidades. 

Raysa se dedica a L. venta D. calzados nuevos, en compras al por mayor y por catálogos, lleva ya varios años realizando diferentes negocios, y con L. venta D. zapatos lleva ya 1 año, al mismo pudo invertirle su primer préstamo con Esperanza, en L. actualidad recibe su 2 prestamos. Se siente muy agradecida por que con los préstamos a podido avanzar y poder invertir en su negocio. Este nuevo préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. mercancías al por mayor. 

Raysa pertenece al grupo Mujeres en Esperanza 1, 2 & 5, un grupo formado por 15 miembros, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una D. las comunidades D. mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad. Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Raysa (standing in the blue blouse), just 23 years old, is a young businesswoman.  Her family is comprised of her parents and some of her siblings.  Her own house is built as a simple structure with a zinc roof and block walls.  Her plans are to continue putting forth great effort while she works.  She wishes to finish her university studies.  That way she will be able to start a family and help her parents with their necessities.

Raysa sells new footwear. Purchases are wholesale and by catalog.  She has been in different businesses for several years.  She has been selling shoes for one year.  She used her first loan from Esperanza to invest in her business.  She is currently receiving her second loan.  She is very grateful for the loans because she has been able to advance and invest in her business.  She will use her new loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

Raysa belongs to the Mujeres en Esperanza (Hopeful Women) 1, 2, & 5 Group.  The group is comprised of 15 members.  Each one of them works day to day in their business activities in Santo Domingo.  It is one of the communities with scant resources located to the north of the city.


Her story represent the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities.  This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Virginia tiene 37 años, tiene 2 hijos menores y está casada con el Sr. Juan Ortega , ella posee una mercería-librería desde hace 2 años y  una  buena clientela formada en el barrio donde vive y sus alrededores.
El sr. Juan trabaja como chofer en una empresa privada, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logran mantener a su familia y brindarle una mejor vida.
Ellos  necesitan de este crédito para la compra de útiles y artículos de mercería en cantidad y así lograr  mejores ganancias.
En el futuro desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old. She has two young children and is married to Sr. Juan Ortega. Two years ago, she opened a shop where she sells gifts and books. Virginia has a well-established customer base in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. Sr. Juan works as a driver for a private company.

With great effort and dedication, Virginia is able to support her family and provide them with a better life. She needs a loan to buy miscellaneous articles and supplies in quantity so that she can generate better earnings. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies & miscellaneous articles (clothing, colognes, stuffed toys, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
Jose Javier G.  de 27 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, tiene 2 hijos  menores de edad  se encuentran estudiando en  la primaria y estan al cuidado de la mamá de ellos quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, Jose  labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace siete año como Policia Municipal, se ha superado con esfuerzo propios.  

Necesita este financiamiento con el apoyo de Kiva  para ponerle verjas a las ventanas, puertas y repellar el frente de la casa. 
Su mayor sueño es brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Javier G., age 27, lives with his life partner. He has 2 young children who are in elementary school and are cared for by their mother, who does the housework. Jose has worked for the Alcaldia Municipal de Juigapla for seven years as a municipal police officer. He has succeeded through his own hard work.

He needs this loan, with the support of Kiva, to install bars on his windows, to install doors, and to plaster the front of his house.
His greatest dream is to offer his family greater security and better living conditions.

loans.use: to install bars, windows, and doors, and to plaster walls

loans.name: Zaida Lideth

texts.es: Zaida Lideth tiene 25 años, tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, está ubicada en su vivienda, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece, Zaida es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de este medio de vida y al mismo tiempo de interactuar con sus clientes. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes entre otros. Ella siempre desea seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ingresos  ya que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que todavía depende de ella.
texts.en:
Zaida Lideth is 25 years old. Her business is a store in her home where most of her customers come to buy the different products she offers.

Zaida is an enterprising woman who enjoys her job and interacting with her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, and other items. She wants to continue working and improving her income because she has a child who is still dependent on her.

loans.use: Operating capital for purchasing candy, soft drinks, bread, basic grains, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel M. de 54 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 hijos mayores: Manuel de 29 años que trabaja en ENACAL quien tiene su familia y vive a parte, y su otra hija de nombre Imara de 28 años que vive con él y trabaja en el Pollo Tip Top ella tambien asume sus gastos y obligaciones de pago,  es madre soltera de 2 niños que don Manuel le ayuda brindandole un hogar donde estar y con ciertos gastos basicos; Don Manuel labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde  hace  veintiun años actualmente se desempeña como Fiscal de Proyectos.  

Agradece a Kiva por el beneficio obtenido con el financiamiento anterior, ya que gracias a esto pudo levantar el porche de su casa. Requiere otro Financiamiento para continuar mejorando la vivienda como es repellar la pared de entrente y darle algunos toques finales al porche.  

Su mayor sueño es dejarles algo a sus nietos y brindarles una buena educacion para que sean ejemplo de personalidades.
texts.en:
Manuel M., age 54, is married and has 2 grown children. The first is Manuel, age 29, who works for ENACAL, has a family of his own, and does not live with Manuel. The other is a daughter named Imara, age 28, who lives with Manuel and works in Pollo Tip Top. She helps with the household costs. She is a single mother of two children, and Manuel helps her by offering her a home to live in and covering certain basic costs. Manuel has worked for the Municipal Town Hall of Juigalpa for 21 years, and currently works as a financial official.

He thanks Kiva for the benefits he obtained from his previous loan, since thanks to that loan he was able to install a porch on his home. He needs another loan to continue improving his home, through for example plastering the front wall and putting some finishing touches on the porch.

His greatest dream is to leave something to his grandchildren and offer them a good education so that they will be good people.

loans.use: home improvements, and plastering the front wall

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq B. is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged sons in Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from the Nagorno-Kharabkh, now living in the small settlement in Bilasuvar built for IDP families.  

In 2004 Natiq opened a fruit and vegetable stand. The best feature of his business is that his stand is in a good location where there is a lot of pedestrian traffic. This is the only source of the income for his family. 

This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He was able to increase the size and variety of his inventory with the help this loan of 2000 AZN. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children and to increase his product inventory. He will use his profits to cover his needs and repay the loan installments on schedule. 

Natiq wants to expand his business. He plans to open grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Wilmer Antonio

texts.es:
Wilmer de 26 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Maritza con quien tiene 3 niños: Ana Maria de 14 años estudiando el 2do. año de secundaria, Luis Manuel de 11 años en 5to grado de primaria y el menor de 1 añito de edad ambos son cuados por su mama, Wilmer labora para la Alcaldia Municipal desde hace dos año actualmente se desempeña como Policia Municipal.  

Esta solicitando el apoyo nuevamente de Kiva en su segundo credito para construir y ampliar la cocina su casa.  

Su sueño es darle mejor comodidad de vida y que no falte el pan de cada dia a su Familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, age 26, is married to Mrs. Maritza. They have 3 children: Ana Maria, age 14, who is in the second year of high school; Luis Manuel, age 11, who is in the fifth grade of elementary school; and the youngest, age 1. The children are cared for by their mother. Wilmer has worked for the Municipal Town Hall for two years, and he currently works as a municipal police officer.

He is requesting Kiva's support again for his second loan, to build and expand the kitchen of his home.

His dream is to make their home a more comfortable place to live, and for his family to never lack their daily bread.

loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Teresita de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Nelly R., ella vive con su marido y sus hijos, trabaja en su cantina, ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, ya que con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el 5º ciclo con sus 16 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the neighborhood of Santa Teresita in the city of Caacupé.

The committee president is Sra. Nelly R.. She lives with her husband and children. Nelly works in a cantina. She and her fellow group members are satisfied with the financial support provided by Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. With this capital, the women have expanded their small business as well as their incomes so that they can achieve a better quality of life.

The women are in their fifth loan cycle and the group has sixteen members.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Sirac

texts.en:
Sirac A. is a 45-year-old man from Bilasuvar. He lives with his wife and four children who are from 23 to 8 years old. Sirac has three daughters and one son, who actively helps him in his cattle-breeding business. He has been engaged in this line of business since 2002. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Sirac is a good client based on his history of repaying his previous loan from AqroInvest. He requested his second loan of 2000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to invest more in his farming. He bought four more cows and thanks to that, the income of his family increased up to 400 AZN per month. Now Sirac has seven cows, but after repaying this loan he would like to take out another loan to buy five more cows.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La Sra. Martina tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene una hija mayor de edad, que ya está independizada.
Se dedica a la fabricación de chipas y chipitas (masa hecha de almidón, comida típica del país) desde hace más de 20 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente como empleada de una pequeña empresa, posteriormente con el esfuerzo y el ahorro de sus ganancias pudo instalar su propia fábrica de chipas ubicada en su domicilio y comprar insumos para fabricar sus propios productos, por la buena calidad se ganó rapidamente el mercado y formó una buena clientela.
La Sra. Martina solicita el crédito para la compra de almidón, queso, y grasa. Martina desde ya agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza que le otorgan.
texts.en:
Martina, 49, is single and has an adult daughter who is already independent.

She has made ‘chipas’ and ‘chipitas’ (dough made from starch, a typical national dish) for over 20 years.  She started out primarily reselling but later on with her effort and savings from her profits she was able to set up her own chipas factory in her home and to buy ingredients to make her own merchandise.  Because of her good products she soon gained market share and established a good customer base.

She is asking for a loan to buy starch, cheese and lard.  Martina thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva ahead of time for the support and trust they grant her.

loans.use: To buy starch, cheese and animal fat.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Mireya pertenece al grupo Jesús esta aqui 1 & 2, un grupo formado por 10 miembro, cada uno D. ellos días a días realizan sus actividades D. negocios en la ciudad D. Santo Domingo, su comunidad se encuentra al norte D. la ciudad y es una D. las zonas mas empobrecidas. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.  

Mireya posee una familia conformada por sus 3 hijos) y su esposo. A quienes le ha dedicado todo su vida para apoyarles y ayudarles a crecer, se siente muy útil al poder llevar ingresos extra a su familia, y lucha día a día para tener un techo propio y vivir estables. 

Mireya posee un ventorrillo, en donD. venD. diferentes vegetales, frutas, carbón, carnes, es un pequeño mostrador D. alimentos. Inicio gracias a su primer préstamo en Esperanza, hace alrededor D. 3 años y en la actualidad esta esperando recibir su 5to. préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, el cual invertirá en la compra D. vegetales como zanahoria, repollo, tomates, papas; también en diferentes frutas y carnes D. pollo y res

Su historia representa a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Mireya belongs to the “Jesús Está Aquí” (Jesus Is Here) 1 & 2 group.  The group is comprised of ten members.  Each one of them works day to day at their business activities in the city of Santo Domingo.  Her community is north of the city, and it is one of the poorest zones.  They mostly work at selling clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, and food, among other miscellaneous products.

Mireya’s family is comprised of her three children and her husband.  She has devoted her whole life to support them and help them grow.  She feels very useful to be able to bring extra income to her family.  She struggles day to day to have a roof over her family’s head and to have a stable life.

Mireya has a small business selling different vegetables, fruit, charcoal, and meat.  It is a small food stand.  She started thanks to her first loan from Esperanza about three years ago.  She is currently waiting to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She will use it to buy vegetables like carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, and potatoes.  She will also buy fruit, chicken, and beef.

Her story represents the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans. They generally live in very poor communities. This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy foods like fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Bermuda shorts, jeans and T-shirts.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
El joven Efraín tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caacupé, Barrio Virgen de los Remedios, distante unos 92km de la capital del País, en donde tiene una librería bien surtida, dicho negocio fue heredado de sus padres hace dos años.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva un crédito para cargar artículos de librería puesto que tiene a lado de su negocio una escuela primaria, y así obtendría más ingreso para su unidad familiar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efraín is 21 years old, single, living with his parents in the city of Caacupé’s Virgen de los Remedios neighborhood, which is located about 92 kilometers from the nation’s capital.  He has a well stocked bookstore there, a business he inherited from his parents two years ago.

He is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a loan to stock school supplies since he has an elementary school next door and this will provide more income for his family unit and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is a 33-year-old man from Bilasuvar. He is married and the loving father of two children. After the birth of his daughter, Ceyran, and his son, Nusrat, life became harder for the young family. 

Ramiz decided to start a cattle-breeding business. His wife does household chores and also helps him in the business. He has been doing this business for about four years and now his normal monthly income is around 300 AZN. Ramiz sells dairy in the local bazaar. 

There were two cows in his farm but diligent Ramiz didn't want to stop there. That is why he requested a loan of 1800 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy four more cows. This is his first loan. Ramiz dreams of buying a piece of land for a larger farm.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis V. de 45 años de edad, casado con la Sra. Idealda Ortega con quien tiene 4 hijos: Nereyda de 22 años la cual es casada y tiene su propia familia, Luis de 18 años es universitario , Jeffrin de 11 años estudiando el 5to grado de primaria y el menor Justin de un dos añitos de edad, Don Luis labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace dos años actualmente se desempeña como Policia Municipal, es una persona esforzada y responsable, sus activos son frutos de su trabajo el cual ha asumido con respnsabilidad y con grandes propositos por cumplir.  

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva por segunda vez para este credito con el cual pretende terminar un cuarto anexo a su casa.  
Sueña con darle mejor condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis V., age 45, is married to Mrs. Idealda Ortega, with whom he has 4 children: Nereyda, age 22, who is married and has her own family; Luis, age 18, a university student; Jeffrin, age 11, who is in the fifth grade of elementary school; and the youngest, Justin, who is 2. Luis has worked for the Juigalpa Municipal Town Hall for two years, and is currently employed as a municipal police officer. He is a hard-working and responsible person. His assets are the fruit of his hard work, which he has done with responsibility and a great desire to succeed.

He is requesting Kiva's support for the second time for this loan, with which he hopes to finish a room added on to his house.
He dreams of offering his family better living conditions.

loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
El señor Hipólito Quiñonez tiene 64 años de edad y vive con su señora Celina Quintana, quien tiene 67 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupé, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Todos sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
El Señor Hipólito vive en la compañía Candia en el barrio María Auxiliadora. En su domicilio cuentan con  plantaciones de frutas cítricas y se dedica a esto desde hace 15años.
Su local de ventas es el mercado.
Por más que el señor Hipólito y su señora trabajen mucho, poseen algunas necesidades que cubrir. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una plantación de mandarinas y pomelos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello ya podrá contar con más frutas para el momento de cosecha en este año.
texts.en:
Mr. Hipólito Quiñones, 64, lives with his wife, Celina Quintana, 67, in the city of Caacupé located about 60 kilometers from the capital city (Asunción).  
All of their children are independent adults.

Hipólito lives in the Candia company in María Auxiliadora neighborhood.  He has grown citrus fruits on his property for the last 15 years.  His place of sale is the market.

No matter how hard Hipólito and his wife work they still have some needs to cover.  He is asking for the loan to buy a mandarin orange and grapefruit orchard.

He is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it’s given for his activity because through it he will have more fruit to harvest this year.

loans.use: To buy a one hectare mandarin orange orchard.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda de 47 años de edad es casada, tiene 3 hijos: Hector de 28 años que trabaja en el EMPA, alexander de 26 años trabaja en la UNAN, ambos le apoyan con los gastos del hogar; y el menor Jader de 9 añitos que estudia la primaria; Doña Zenayda labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace veintitres años actualmente se desempeña como Responsable del Cementerio Municipal de esta ciudad, ha superado los oabtaculos de la vida con puro sacrificio, desempeñando de lo mejor su trabajo con dedicacion y con creditos que hasta la fecha ha asumido con respondabilidad.  

Solicita por tercera vez el apoyo de Kiva a quien agradece desde ya por esta gestion brindada, requiere credito con el objetivo cambiar el techo de la casa antes que entre el invierno.  

Su mayor sueño es reparacion total de la casa, el cual pretende lograr poco a poco, siendo este el patrimonio que le dejará a sus hijos.
texts.en: Zenayda, 47, is married and has three sons: Hector, 28, works for EMPA and Alexander, 26, works for UNAN. They both contribute to the household expenses. Her youngest son, Jader, is 9 years old and in primary school. Ms. Zenayda has been working for the city government of Juigalpa for the last 23 years, as a caretaker for the municipal cemetery. She has overcome life's obstacles through pure sacrifice, performing her work as best she can, and through taking out loans, which she has done responsibly so far. She is requesting support through Kiva for the third time and she is grateful for the guidance she has been offered. She needs this loan in order to replace the roof on her house before winter starts. Her greatest dream is to repair her entire house, which she has been trying to do little by little, as this will be the legacy she leaves for her sons. [To see Zenayda's previous Kiva loans, click here and here.]

loans.use: to replace the roof on her house before winter

loans.name: Danilza

texts.es:
La señora Danilza es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada y tiene un hijo en su poder.
La señora Danilza, se dedica a la confección D. zapatos, son varios años que viene trabajando en esta actividad, empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital y ahora tiene el apoyo D. Manuela Ramos, con esos préstamos ha podido comprar los materiales que necesita para trabajar.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 revistas D. confección D. zapatos, 6 docenas D. piedras D. diferentes tamaños y colores para tejer sus zapatos, nylon, agujas,  2 conos D. hilos macramé delgado, 10 metros D. tiras para zapato en diferentes colores, 10 plantillas D. zapatos, también en diferentes tallas.
La señora Danilza contribuye con los gastos D. su casa gracias a los ingresos D. su negocio... para la tranquilidad D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Danilza is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 58 years old, married and has a son still in her care.

Danilza is a shoemaker.  She’s been in this line of work for several years.  She started the business with a small amount of capital and now she has Manuela Ramos’ support.  With the loans she has been able to buy the materials she needs for her work.

With her new, 1500 new sol loan, she will buy three shoemaking magazines, 6 dozen stones in various sizes and colors to weave into the shoes, nylon, needles, two cones of thin macramé thread, 10 meters of shoelaces in assorted colors, 10 insoles for shoes also in different sizes.

Danilza contributes to household expenses, thanks to the income from her business, for her husband’s peace of mind.

loans.use: She will buy three shoe-making magazines, six dozen stones in various sizes and colors to weave her shoes, nylon, needles, two cones of thin macramé thread, 10 meters of shoelaces in various colors, ten insoles in various sizes.

loans.name: Rodny Ariel

texts.es:
Rodny Ariel M.  de 27 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Thelma Martinez, con quien tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en primaria; ella se encarga del cuido de la casa y la familia.  Rodny labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace tres años actualmente se desempeña como Responsable de Programacion de Poyectos.  

Esta solicitando su segundo credito con el objetivo de construir el pantri de su casa.
Su mayor sueño es brindarle todas las comodidades a su familia el cual hará poco a poco con la Ayuda que le brinda afodenic y kiva a quien agradece mucho
texts.en:
Rodny Ariel M. is 27 years old and married to Thelma Martinez, with whom he has two children, currently elementary school students. Thelma works taking care of the household and family. Rodny has worked for three years for the Municipality of Juigalpa, in the position of Project Planning Manager.   

He is requesting his second loan, with the aim of constructing a pantry in his house. 

His greatest dream is to provide his family with all of the household conveniences, which he will do little by little with the help provided by Afodenic and Kiva, to whom he is very grateful.

loans.use: Improving his home

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es: Gilmer tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica arrendar cuartos en su casa propia, pero en un inicio para empezar a acondicionar, tuvo que hacer uso de sus ahorros, fruto de los largos años de trabajo como docente, y que hasta el momento es su fuente de ingresos. Sus hijos la apoyan en este trabajo, administrando las rentas de las habitaciones a sus inquilinos y en lo posible tratan de alquilar a personas responsables para asegurarse los ingresos mensuales. Con el pasar de los años ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio que ha decidido seguir ampliando y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para  incrementar sus ingresos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita,  le servirá para arreglar una habitación de su casa y poder arrendarlo mas adelante.
texts.en: Gilmer, 42, lives with his wife and their 2 children in their own house.  For the past 6 years he has rented rooms in the house, but when he started to fix up the rooms, he had to use his savings.  The savings came from his many years as a teacher and it is still his source of income.  His children help him with the work.  They handle the rent, the tenants, and as best as they can, they try to rent to responsible people so that they receive monthly income.  With time he has seen the viability of this business grow and he has decided to continue enlarging and improving the infrastructure of his house to increase the earnings.  This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support and he thanks the people who have lent him what he has requested.  It will be very useful in improving the business.  He will use the loan to fix up a room in the house so that he can rent it in the future.

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of a room in his house..

loans.name: Flores De Libertad Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” iniciará su  segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio surtida, taller mecánico, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de ropa.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociacion comunal, indica que forma parte de  “Flores de Libertad”  medio año.  Actualmente vive con su pareja y ambos cuidan de sus hijos.  Su negocio es la compra - venta de ropa nueva.  La señora Juana indica que antes de ser cliente de Pro Mujer era ama de casa y negociaba con ropa usada,  sufria por que el dinero no le alcanzaba, ahora que ella se ha capitalizado con un crédito de Pro Mujer, cambió de negocio y vende ropa nueva, tiene un ingreso que le permite aportar a la familia, se siente más contenta.  Por su parte el esposo, quien se encontraba en sala, dice que le gusta que su esposa este en el grupo por que ya esta dejando de ser timida.

El crédito que ha solicitado la senora Juana le permitirá comprar mas ropa y surtir la mercaderia que esta vendiendo. 

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta compartir con el grupo.
texts.en:
The “FLORES DE LIBERTAD” (Flowers of Freedom) communal association will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members.  Their businesses are varied: vegetable sales, stocked neighborhood store, machine shop, food sales, fruit sales and clothing sales.

Juana, President of the communal association, indicates that she’s been part of “Flores de Libertad” for half a year.  She lives with her spouse and both care for their children.  Her business is new clothing sales.  Juana states that before being a Pro Mujer client she was a housewife and traded with used clothing.  She suffered because money was never enough.  Now that she has capitalized with a loan from Pro Mujer she has changed business and now sells new clothes.  She has income that makes it possible for her to contribute to the family and she feels happier.  For his part her husband, who was present in the room, states that he likes that his wife is in this group because she is starting to be less timid.

The loan which Juana has requested will allow her to buy more clothing and replace the merchandise she sells.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes sharing with the group.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Efa Sarai

texts.es:
La señora Efa ES socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del Distrito Calleria, Departamento Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se desempeña como mecánico y tiene 5 hijos (2 mayores e independientes y 3 que todavía son pequeños y dependen de ella).
La señora Efa lleva 12 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y que ha estado invirtiendo en la compra y venta de madera, negocio que le ha sido muy lucrativo y ha mejorado la situación económica de su hogar.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 2,500 pies de madera en tablones, que es más comercial y lo va poder colocar más rápido.
Para la señora Efa Manuela Ramos ha sido quien le dió la mano para poder tener un capital y hacerlo trabajar, trabajo que le va muy bien hasta el momento y complementa con lo que su esposo aporta a su casa.
La señora Efa al mismo tiempo está generando trabajo a otra persona que se encarga de las labores de su hogar, porque no tiene tiempo para ocuparse de eso, su trabajo le demanda todo el dia.
texts.en:
Efa is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women” communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 37 years old, married and her husband works as a mechanic.  They have five children (two adult, independent ones and 3 who are still little and depend on her).

Efa has been working for 12 years with Manuela Ramos loans.  She has been investing them in lumber sales, a business that has proven to be quite profitable and has improved her household economy.

With this 3000 new sol loan she will buy 2500 feed of wood beams which is more commercial and she will be able to sell quickly.

For Efa, Manuela Ramos has been who gave her a hand in order to have capital to put to work, work which to date she’s done well in and complements what her husband contributes to the home.

At the same time, Efa is generating employment for another person who does her household chores because she doesn’t have time for that; her business keeps her busy all day.

loans.use: To buy 2500 linear feet of wood beams.

loans.name: Tessi Yvone

texts.es:
La señora Tessi es socia del banco comunal Virgen De La puerta del distrito calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, un hijo menor y su esposo trabaja en un casino.
Tessi solo lleva un año como socia de este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 invertirá en la compra de más productos para stock y así tener prodcutos disponibles para cualquier ocasión y así poder conservar su clientela, porque ahora la competencia es demasiada y si dan facilidad, van a poder conservar su clientela,  pagara s/.700.00 de su caja de pedidos y comprará 3 colonias para bebes,  1 talco para bebe, 2 champú, 3 perfumes para damas, 3 colonias para caballero, 2 cremas para el cuerpo, 5 labiales, 3 esmaltes de uñas.
La señora Tessi  tiene una niña recién nacida y el trabajo que tiene le da tiempo para estar con su niña, de esa manera ayuda también con algunos gastos a su esposo.
Manuela Ramos ha sido de gran ayuda para ella porque puede trabajar y generar ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Tessi is a member of the “Virgen de la Puerta” (Virgin of the Door) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She’s 21 years old and has a minor son; her husband is employed at a casino.

Tessi has only been a member of this communal bank for a year.  She sells catalogue beauty products.

With this 1700 new sol loan she will buy more products to stock in order to have merchandise on hand for whatever occasion thus keeping her clientele because competition is now quite heavy and if they provide any advantages they will keep their customers.  She will pay 700 new soles per case of orders and will buy 3 infant colognes, 1 baby talc, 2 shampoos, 3 women’s perfumes, 3 men’s colognes, 2 body creams, 5 lipsticks and 3 nail polishes.

Tessi has a newborn daughter and the work she has gives her time to spend with her little girl as well as helping her husband with some of the expenses.

Manuela Ramos has been of great help to her because she can work and generate income for her home.

loans.use: She will buy three infant colognes, 1 baby talc, 2 shampoos, 3 women’s perfumes, 3 men’s colognes, 2 body creams, 5 lipsticks and 3 nail polishes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del banco comunal María Montessori del distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad.
Doris lleva recién 2 años perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, que le dio acogida en uno de los tantos bancos comunales que tiene.
La señora Doris se dedica a la venta de comida típica como Juanes, pescado asado, pollo asado, maduros, tacacho, esta actividad la realiza en forma ambulatria en la vereda de su casa y lo hace todos los días por las noches, porque ella es el sustento de su hogar ya que su esposo es minusválido.
COn éste préstamo de 2,500.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el arreglo de su local, mandara hacer un pedazo de piso y ampliar un poco más su techo, porque cuando llueve ya no puede vender, comprará 5 planchas de calamina, 3 bolsas de cemento, 6 listones, ½ kilo de clavo de calamina, ½ de clavo de 3 pulgadas, 1 metro de ripio, y el pago de la mano de obra.
Doris está contenta porque trabaja para poder sustentar los gastos de su casa y poder estar al lado de su esposo que la necesita bastante.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the María Montessori communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 54 years old, married and has 5 adult children.

Doris has been part of the Manuela Ramos family, who welcomed her into one of the many communal banks it has, for just two years.

Doris sells typical Peruvian dishes like: Juanes, grilled fish, grilled chicken, bananas, tacacho, in an ambulatory fashion on the sidewalk outside her house every day during the evening because she’s the only breadwinner for her home since her husband is disabled.

With this 2500 new sol loan she will invest in improving her site.  She will have a piece of flooring made and will extend her roof a bit because when it rains she can’t continue selling.  She will buy 5 sheets of plywood, 3 sacks of cement, 6 ribbons, ½ kilo of plywood nails, ½ of 3-inch nails, 1 meter of gravel and will pay labor costs.

Doris is happy because she works to cover household expenses while being alongside her husband who needs her quite a lot.

loans.use: To repair her business’ floor and roof.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, siendo esta actividad ejercida los fines de semana, que a lado de su esposo, logran vender en cantidad, permitiéndole sostenerse económicamente toda la semana. Su trabajo consiste en elegir y comprar dichos animales, para ello estudia todo lo necesario sobre la crianza de reses, de esa manera logra hacer una buena negociación. En adelante desea tener más capital de trabajo, asimismo conseguir animales de raza, ya que su cotización es mayor que los otros animales comunes. Es su crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar más animales.
texts.en:
Celinda, 50, lives with her husband and two children in a leased house.  For the last 10 years she’s been a cattle merchant.  This activity takes place on weekends.  Together with her husband they sell quite a bit allowing them to support themselves all week.  He work consists in selecting and buying said animals.  To do so, she studies everything concerning cattle raising so that she can carry out a good negotiation.  In the future she’d like to have more working capital as well as to get pedigreed animals since they bring better prices than other common animals.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the loan to buy more animals.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra pertenece al banco comunal “Bannen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Lota. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de perfumes alternativos, desde hace 6 años, este negocio lo realiza de manera independiente. Además Sandra cuenta con un trabajo estable de manipuladora de alimentos en un casino, de lunes a viernes en las mañanas. Por lo que la disponibilidad en su negocio es por las tardes de lunes a sábado. Sus ventas son a través de catálogos, en su casa u oficinas de sus clientes. Con este negocio más el trabajo dependiente de Sandra, logró obtener su casa propia. 
Con este préstamo, Sandra hará sus encargos de perfumes a través de catálogo a la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), los que llegan a través de encomienda.
Su sueño es comprar mas perfumes con la finalidad de aumentar el número de clientes e ingresos, ya que Sandra quiere invertir en  un nuevo negocio, para la temporada de invierno, específicamente venta de leña.
