Para Sandra los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un apoyo que le ha permitido crecer en su negocio, y aumentar sus ingresos, sumado a esto le han servido las enseñanzas sobre como organizar el capital e invertir de manera eficiente.
Lota significa en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches, "pequeño lugarejo”. Es una comuna costera ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Lota es célebre por sus grandes yacimientos carboníferos muy ligados a la historia y desarrollo económico de Chile, así como por sus trabajadores de la minería subterránea, cuyas difíciles condiciones de vida fueron descritas por el escritor chileno Baldomero Lillo en su libro "Subterra".
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “Bannen” communal bank in the city of Lota.  She is an alternative perfumes merchant.  She’s been in this line of work for 6 years; she runs the business independently.  In addition, Sandra has a stable job as a Food Handler in a casino, Monday through Saturday afternoons.  Her sales are via catalogue either in her home or at her customers’ offices.  With this business and with her job Sandra managed to obtain a house of her own.

Sandra will use this loan to get her catalogue perfume orders filled in the city of Santiago (capital of Chile) which are then sent to her via delivery service.

Her dream is to buy more perfumes aiming at increasing the number of customers and of income because Sandra wants to invest in a new business for winter, specifically the sale of firewood.

For Sandra, Fondo Esperanza loans have meant support that has made it possible for her business to grow and her income to increase.  In addition, the training sessions have been very useful, especially on how to organize her capital and invest efficiently.

Lota, in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuche indigenous peoples, means “small hamlet.” It is a coastal commune located near the city of Concepción in the south of Chile in the Bíobío region.  Lota is famous for its coal deposits which are tightly tied to Chile’s economic development history as well as for its underground miners whose difficult living conditions were described by the Chilean author, Baldomero Lillo, in his book “Subterra.”

loans.use: For alternative perfumes.

loans.name: Cesia

texts.es:
La señorita Cesia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del distrito de calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 20 años de edad.
Tiene una pequeña bodega, recién lleva 1 año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
La señorita Cesia invertirá su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles en la compra de productos para su bodega, como son: ½ caja de leche, 1 caja de galletas, 2 tiras de chistriz, 2 tiras de chizitos, 1 bolsa de galleta de animalitos, 25 kilos de azúcar, 3 bolsas de caramelos, 1 paquete de agua. 1 paquete de guarana, 25 kilos de arroz, ½ caja de aceite de medio litro.
La señorita Cesia está aprovechando su juventud y tiene todas las ganas de seguir trabajando.  Tiene mucha fe de que su cegocio va ir creciendo poco apoco.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos pudo empezar a trabajar, porque le dieron un pequeño capital, para iniciar la idea del negocio que tenia.
texts.en:
Señorita Cesia is a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias (Women United) in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 20 years old and has a small grocery store. She recently marked her one-year anniversary of working with loans from Manuela Ramos.

Señorita Cesia will invest her new loan of 1000 PEN in the purchase of products for her store, such as 1/2 box of milk, 1 box of crackers, 4 strips of cheese snacks, 1 bag of animal crackers, 25 kilos of sugar, 3 bags of candy, 1 package of bottled water, 1 package of guarana (a local fruit drink), 25 kilos of rice, and 1/2 box of half-liter bottles of oil.

Señorita Cesia makes good use of her youth and has all the will to continue working. She has great faith that her business is going to increase little by little.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she was able to begin working, because they gave her a little capital to begin the business that she had an idea for.

loans.use: Stock her store.

loans.name: Jardin Del Altiplano Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Jardín del Altiplano” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la banca comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la presidenta, la señora Olga.   Los negocios que las integrantes llevan adelante son variados: lavado de arena, venta de  coca, cría de conejos, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de llauchas (empanadas grandes con relleno de queso, su característica es que es jugosa), venta de ropa.

La señora Olga, presidenta de la asociacion comunal “Jardín del Altiplano”, indica que es la primera vez que solicita un prestamo.  Actualmente casada, madre de siete hijos, la actividad que desarrolla en su hogar es el tejido de camas en telar, a pedido.  Este primer crédito es por Bs 2000.-  y esta dirigido a la compra de lana y tambien al compra de coca, pues el negocio familiar ha sido la venta de esta hoja medicinal (la infusión de la hoja de coca puede curar dolores de estómago y dolores de cabeza producidos por la altura, la ciudad de El Alto está a más de 3.500 mts.).

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Jardín del Altiplano” (Garden of Altiplano) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Community Association. The group consists of eight members. This group is led by its Board of Directors and the head of the board is the president, Sra. Olga. The members succeed in various businesses: sand washing, selling coca leaves, breeding rabbits, selling vegetables, operating a neighborhood store, selling “llauchas” (large turnovers filled with cheese and known for being quite juicy), and selling clothes.

Sra. Olga, the president of the “Jardín del Altiplano” Communal Association, says this is the first time she has requested a loan. She is currently married and the mother of seven children. Olga operates a business out of her home in which she weaves bedding on a loom based on orders she receives. Her first loan will be in the amount of 2000 BOB and used for buying wool. She will also buy coca leaves since her family has a side business selling medicinal leaves (an infusion of coca leaves can be used to cure stomach aches and headaches caused by altitude sickness since the city of El Alto stands at more than 3,500 meters above sea level).

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Sra. Olga replied that she enjoys having this loan.

loans.use: Purchase wool for weaving & medicinal coca leaves to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing fast food

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
La señora Sofía  trabaja desde hace 10 años con Manuela Ramos y tiene su negocio en las afueras del colegio Comercio, donde los jóvenes esperan la salida o el recreo (break) para salir a comprar refrescos, tamales o papa rellena, esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de una persona.
La señora Sofía invertirá su nuevo préstamo en la compra de 1 saco de azúcar, 1 galón de aceite, 1 bolsa de caramelos, 1 bolsa de chicle, 1 kilo de fariña, 1 balde de 25 litros, 5 paquetes de bolsa, 1 paquete de sorbetes.
La señora Sofía trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día solo por las noches, llega a su casa para compartir con su esposo y sus hijos.
Manuela Ramos ha sabido inculcar a las mujeres que también pueden aportar dinero para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofía is a member of the Communal Bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children.

Sra. Sofía has worked with Manuela Ramos for ten years. She has an establishment set up in front of a business school where young people hang out when they are waiting to leave or on break. There they are able to buy soft drinks, tamales, or stuffed potatoes. Sofía operates her business with the help of one employee.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of one sack of sugar, one gallon of oil, one bag of caramels, one bag of gum, one kilo of flour, one 25-liter bucket, five packets of sacks, and one packet of sorbets. Her business is open all day Monday through Friday. At night, she comes home to be with her husband and children.

Manuela Ramos instills in women the knowledge that they also can generate income for their families.

loans.use: Purchase one sack of sugar, one gallon of oil, one bag of caramels, one bag of gum, one kilo of flour, one 25-liter bucket, five packets of sacks, and one packet of sorbets

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La señora Felicia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como agente de seguridad, tiene 3 hijos pero solo uno vive en su casa.
Felicia tiene su negocio de venta de bebidas por las mañanas y lo hace cerca a un grifo muy lejos de su casa, donde tiene que estar casi todo el día y casi no puede estar con su hijo, es parte del sacrificio que tiene que hacer por trabajar para el bienestar de su familia.
Este nuevo préstamo de S/1,800.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva caja térmica que utiliza para enfriar sus bebidas, 3 cajas de néctar, 2 paquetes de agua, 1 paquete de guarana, 1 paquete de pepsicola, 2 jabas de coca cola, 1 paquete de inca cola chica descartable.
La señora Felicia lleva 8 años trabajando en su negocio, y le ha servido, para poder ayudar a su esposo y tener con que solventar los gastos del colegio de su hijo que todavía tiene a su cargo.
La señora Felicia agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo los consejos que imparten las promotoras para que las socias mejoren cada dia más y sepan sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. Her husband works as a security guard. They have three children, but only one lives at home.

Felicia has a business selling beverages in the mornings near a gas station that is located some distance away from her house. She is at her business almost every day, so she has little time to be with her son. This is part of the sacrifice required by her work so that she can provide for the welfare of her family.

This new loan of 1800 PEN will be invested in the purchase of an ice chest for keeping beverages cold, three cases of nectar, two cases of water, one case of guarana (a caffeinated beverage), one case of Pepsi Cola, two cases of Coca Cola, and one case of Inca Cola.

Sra. Felicia has worked in her business for eight years. It has enabled her to help her husband and cover the educational expenses of her son who is still under her care. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the advice the loan officers have provided so that the members can improve each day and move their businesses forward.

loans.use: Purchase an ice chest & a variety of beverages

loans.name: Donato Alberto

texts.es:
Trabajar como independiente siempre ha sido el sueño de Donato Alberto M., quien a sus 53 años de edad espera convertirse en un microempresario exitoso. Actualmente este campesino además de trabajar en diferentes labores en el campo, desde hace un año inició con la venta de pescado en la que ve una oportunidad para salir adelante y contribuir con el progreso de sus 3 hijos. 

Caminar largas jornadas para llevarle a sus clientes el pescado que trae desde un municipio de Antioquia-Colombia es uno de los sacrificios que debe realizar Donato para lograr vender su producto. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar más variedad de pescado y así aumentar sus ventas. A futuro Donato no sólo espera comprar una moto sino tener su propio local donde pueda ofrecer su pescado.
texts.en:
Working independently has always been the dream of Donato Alberto M.. He is 53 years old and wants to become a successful small businessman. At the moment, Donato is a field laborer who performs different jobs on a farm. He started selling fish a year ago because he saw an opportunity to get ahead and contribute toward the progress of his three children.

Donato must walk many hours to bring his customers fish from the municipality of Antioquia, Colombia. This is one of the sacrifices he must make in order to sell his product.

This entrepreneur is in current need of a loan in order to buy a wider variety of fish so that he can increase his sales. In the future, Donato hopes to buy a motorcycle as well as open his own shop where he can sell fish.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Violeta es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas del Distrito D. calleria, Departamento  D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos y está separada D. su esposo hace varios años.
La señora Violeta, lleva trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace varios años, dinero que le ha servido para comprar parte D. sus maquinas,  se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, tiene su propio taller que funciona en su casa. Actualmente la persona que le ayuda es una D. sus nueras.
Violeta  invertirá  el nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,800.00 nuevos soles en la compra D. materiales para su taller Como son: 6 conos D. hilos duro D. colores que más utiliza, 4 conos D. hilos D. remalle, ½ doc. D. tiza sastre, 10 cortes D. tela, 5 metro D. algodón pima estampado, 5 metros D. algodón llano, 1 cono D. elástico, 2 doc. D. cierres, un ciento D. botones D. varios tamaños.
La señora Violeta sigue trabajando aun teniendo un dolor tan granD. como es la pérdida irreparable D. uno D. sus hijos, pena que todavía no logra superar; "seguirá trabajando con Manuela  Ramos  por muchos años más".
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors), which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, has five children, and has been separated from her spouse for several years.

Sra. Violeta has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for many years. The money has been used to buy parts for the machines she uses for making clothes. She operates her business out of her home and one of her daughters-in-law currently works as her assistant.

Violeta will invest this new loan of 1800 PEN in the purchase of materials for her workshop such as six cones of durable thread in the most used colors, four cones of mesh, a half dozen boxes of tailor’s chalk, ten bolts of fabric, five meters of patterned pima cotton cloth, five meters of plain cotton cloth, one cone of elastic, two dozen zippers, and a hundred buttons of various sizes.

Sra. Violeta continues to work in order to deal with the pain of the loss of one of her children which she has still yet to overcome. She says, “I will continue to work with Manuela Ramos for many more years to come.”

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 36 años, vive en casa de sus familiares en compañía de sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, en donde elabora polos y camisas, que son los que más produce y  más demanda tiene, permitiéndole aumentar sus ganancias. En este trabajo, sus hijos la apoyan tanto en la confección como en la comercialización. Ahora el mercado donde vende su mercadería le exige más producción, esto es motivo suficiente para continuar adelante con la proyección de expandir los lugares de venta. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Dolores is 36 years old and lives in the home of relatives with her three children. For the past three years she has been manufacturing clothes, such as pullovers and shirts of which she produces most since they are the most in demand. This enables her to increase her income. Her children help with both making and selling the clothes. The current market requires that she produce more. Dolores has sufficient justification to move forward with her project of expanding her sales to more locations.

This is her first loan with MFP. Dolores is happy to know that she has financial support and thanks everyone who approved her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of fabric and thread in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread in bulk

loans.name: Auristela

texts.es:
La señora Auristela es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos que ya son mayores.
La señora Auristela tiene su negocio en su casa, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, generalmente desayunos todos los fines D. semana y lo hace con la ayuda D. sus hijas que son las que atienden a los clientes y la señora Auristela es la que se encarga D. sazonar y asar las carnes.
La señora Auristela invertirá su nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles en la compra D. 2 juegos D. mesas D. madera y 2 manteles, 1 parrilla más granD. y 2 sacos D. carbón. 
La señora Auristela es socia D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 años, estos préstamos le sirven para poder pagar sus cuotas mensuales y también poder comprarse lo que necesita para su uso personal.  Habiendo quedado viuda ha tenido que trabajar duro para poder educar  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Auristela is a member of the Communal Bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has six grown children.

Sra. Auristela has a business in her home where she sells food, generally breakfasts which she offers on the weekends. She has the help of her daughters, who are in charge of attending to the customers while she is responsible for seasoning and grilling the meats.

Sra. Auristela will invest her new loan of 1000 PEN in the purchase of two wooden tables, two tablecloths, one large grill, and two sacks of charcoal.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for eight years. The loans have enabled her to pay for her monthly expenses as well as acquire what she needs for personal use. After becoming a widow, Auristela worked hard to proviD. an education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase two wooden tables, two tablecloths, one large grill, and two sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de CD, DVD y discos en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, es un hombre responsable que disfruta de su negocio, tiene 1 hijo de 10 años a su cargo. La ubicación de su negocio es en el parque donde transitan muchos clientes y le solicitan diferentes pedidos de discos él siempre se preocupa por complacerlos. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como películas recientes, disco de música entre otros.
texts.en:
Fernando is 38 years old and has a business selling CDs, DVDs, and other types of discs. He has been in this business for more than ten years. Fernando is a responsible man who enjoys his work. He has a ten year old son under his care. His business is located in a park where many customers pass by and request different types of discs. He is always concerned with trying to please them.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise, such as the most recent movies, music discs, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase the most recent movies, music discs, and other items

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito D. calleria y departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años D. edad y 4 hijos.  Su esposo es profesor jubilado.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. pescado seco y lo hace por el rio Ucayali, para poder ver más rápido su ganancia los venD. directamente a los almacenes que hay aquí en Pucallpa.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos comprará: 1 saco D. pescado liza seco, 1 saco D. pescado maparate seco, 1 saco D. pacotana seco, 1 saco D. pescado boca chico.
La señora Betty tiene que viajar en lancha vaR. días para poder comprar su pescado seco, pasando toda clase D. incomodidades, pero dice que el trabajo es así y que todo tiene un sacrificio, su esposo es el que se queda cuidando su casa mientras ella se encuentra D. viaje.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has four children. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Betty has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for three years. She buys and sells dried fish that comes from the Ucayali River. To earn a quicker profit, she sells directly to the stores located here in Pucallpa.

This new loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy one sack of dried striped mullet, one sack of dried Amazonian catfish, one sack of dried “pacotana” (a local species of fish), and one sack of dried “bocachico” (another variety of fish native to South America).

Sra. Betty has to travel several days by boat in order to buy dried fish, which can be uncomfortable. However, she says the work is what it is and everything requires sacrifice. Her husband looks after the home while she travels.

loans.use: Purchase different types of dried fish

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se desempeña como motocarrista (transportista), tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad.
La señora Mercedes lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años, tiempo que ha estado cumpliendo mes a mes todo sus pagos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, esta actividad la realiza en su casa ya que tiene sus productos en exhibición.

Su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de  3 perfumes para varón, 2 perfumes para damas, 2 cremas para mano, 1 loción para el cuerpo,2 colonias para bebes, 2 talcos para bebes, una vitrina para conservar y mostrar mejor sus productos el cual lo hace muy orgullosa.
La señora Mercedes quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos mucho tiempo más porque se siente bien estando en ese grupo de personas afortunadas por tener un capital para trabajar y así poder ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Merceses is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" communal bank, district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali.  She is 60 years old and married and her husband works as a transport driver.  She has two adult children.

Mrs. Mercedes has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  She has always made her payments on time.  She sells beauty products out of her home.

She plans to use the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy 3 men's perfumes, 2 women's perfumes, 2 handcreams, 1 body lotion, 2 baby colognes, 2 baby powders and a showcase in which to preserve and display her products with pride.  Mrs. Mercedes wants to work with Manuela Ramos for a long time because she enjoys being surrounded by the other fortunate members and because with the working capital she can help her husband.

loans.use: To buy 3 men's perfumes, 2 women's perfumes, 2 handcreams, 1 body lotion, 2 baby colognes, 2 baby powders, a showcase

loans.name: Leonor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito D. calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 64 años D. edad y tiene 3 hijos mayores
La señora Leonor  lleva 1 año trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, que le ha servido para poder comprar algunos productos para surtir su negocio.
La señora Leonor tiene una bodega pequeña pero bien surtida D. productos comestibles, se dedica por completo a su negocio porque también es una mujer que vive sola.
Su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá totalmente en implementar mas el negocio comprando: una pequeña vitrina D. vidrio, 2 cajas D. galletas rellenitas, 1 caja D. chocolate, 1 caja D. lentejitas, 3 bolsas D. caramelos, 1 bolsa D. tofi, 2 cajas D. chicle, 1 caja D. chocolate sapito, 1 paquete D. wafer.
La señora Leonor está trabajando porque hacerlo es parte D. su vida y también porque lo necesita para sentirse bien con ella misma, agradece a Manuela Ramos porque ha pensado en las mujeres y sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" communal bank in the district of Calleria in the department of Ocayali.  She is 64 years old and has three adult children.

Mrs. Leonor has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for a year.  She has used the loans to supply her business.  She has a small store that she keeps stocked with different food products.  This is a full-time job for her since she lives alone.

She plans to use the new loan for 1,000 PEN to buy more items for her business such as a small glass showcase, 2 packages of filled cookies, 1 box of chocolates, 1 box of chocolate drops, 3 bags of caramels, 1 bag of tofi, 2 bags of chewing gum, 1 box of little frog chocolate and 1 package of wafers.

Mrs. Leonor says working is part of her life and she wants to feel good about herself.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women in need.

loans.use: To buy a glass showcase, 2 packages of cookies, 1 box of chocolates, 1 box of chocolate drops, 3 bags of caramels, 1 bag of tofi, 2 boxes of chewing gum, 1 box of little frog chocolate, 1 package of wafers

loans.name: Mulay (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay esta formado por 11 mujeres que son amigas y vecinas, viven en una misma comunidad y en su mayor parte se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales pero también realizan otras actividades de comercio. Viven en la comunidad de Maluay caracterizándose este sector porque se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza en donde se respira un aire de tranquilidad fuera de los ruidos de la ciudad.

La Señora. Ruth Adriana M. vive por la comunidad de la Paz que pertenece a Maluay, tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes por el momento pasan en casa. Su esposo trabaja en un taller realizando estucos (cielos rasos), viven en su casa propia.
Doña Ruth Adrina  es costurera actividad que desempeña hace 6 años, es profesional en esta rama ya que tiene su titulo, labora en una fabrica de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos iniciando en esta actividad con su segundo crédito. Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este grupo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es terminar  su casa.

La Señora. María Doraliza Q. vive en la comunidad de la Paz que  pertenece Maluay, nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada
por sus vecinas de la comunidad. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su consumo, también cría animales como: cerdos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su propia comunidad.
Doña María Doraliza tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, sus dos hijas siguientes trabajan  y le ayudan económicamente en los gastos del hogar y sus cinco últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es albañil y viven en su casita la misma que fue construida entre los dos.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cerdos. Su sueño es ampliar su casa.

Nota: En la foto nos acompaña una niña que es hija de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The Maluay communal bank is comprised of 11 women who are friends and neighbors.  They live in the same community and most of them are involved in farming and raising livestock.  Some of them are merchants.  They live in the Maluay community which is known for its natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere, away from the noisy cities.

Mrs. Ruth Adriana M. lives in the community of La Paz which belongs to Maluay.  She is 24 years old, married and has two children who live at home.  Her husband is a drywall worker.  They live in their own home.

Mrs. Ruth Adrina has been a seamstress for six years.  She has a professional diploma and works in a factory Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  At home she raises chickens and has used two loans for this business activity.  This is her third loan through the communal bank since she was invited by her mother-in-law to become a member.  She plans to use the loan to buy chickens.  Her goal is to finish her home.

Mrs. María Doraliza Q. lives in the community of La Paz which belongs to Maluay.  This member has had two loans through the communal bank and she was invited to join the group by neighbors in her community.  She grows crops for her own consumption.  She also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her own neighborhood

Mrs. María Doraliza is 43 years old, married and has 8 children.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently.  The next two daughters work and help her with household expenses.  The other five children study at the local school.  Her husband is a bricklayer and they live in the house they both built.

She plans to use to loan to buy more pigs.  Her dream is to finish her home.

Note: In the photo there is a little girl accompanying us.  She's the daughter of one of the members.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Carol

texts.es:
La señora Carol es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, está casada, tiene 36 años de edad y 3 hijos menores.
Carol se dedica a la venta de especería y lo hace en la puerta de su casa, porque esta por uno de los mercados más populosos de Pucallpa, su trabajo no le quita tanto tiempo porque sus hijas la ayudan, sobre todo ahora que están de vacaciones.
La señora Carol invertirá su préstamo de S/1,800.00 en la compra de mas especerías, como son: ½ caja de aceite de ajonjolí, 1/2 caja de tau sí, 1 paquete de canela china, 25 paquetes de fideos chino, 10 paquetes de wantan, 1 caja de aceite vegetal, 3 tiras de condimentos para asado.
La señora Carol de esa manera aporta dinero para su hogar y que es de gran ayuda para su esposo que trabaja como empleado público.
Manuela Ramos, mediante sus promotoras, ha sabido orientar a las socias de los diferentes bancos comunales, muchas de ellas lo han puesto en práctica y les está yendo bien su negocio
texts.en:
Mrs. Carol is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" communal bank in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 36 years old, married and has three minor children.

Carol sells spices out of her home since she lives very near one of the busiest markets in Pucallpa.  She doesn't need to spend a lot of time at her job because her daughters help her out, especially now that they are on vacation.

Mrs. Carol plans to use the loan for 1,800 PEN to buy more spices such as a 1/2 case of sesame oil, a 1/2 case of Tau Si, a package of Chinese cinnamon, 25 packages of Chinese noodles, 10 packages of Wantan, a case of vegetal oil and 3 strips of condiments for roasts.

Mrs. Carol is able to earn an income with her business and is of great help to her husband who is a civil servant.  Manuela Ramos, through its promoters, has been able to guide many members of the different communal banks.  Many of them have put what they have learned into practice and their businesses are going well.

loans.use: To buy noodles, Chinese spices and sesame oil

loans.name: Rosa Lili

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años D. edad y 4 hijos mayores.  Su esposo se desempeña como albañil
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta D. ropas usadas y lleva trabajando en este negocio hace varios años, que lo hace como para sentirse bien y poder tener sus pequeños ingresos.
Su nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra D. más ropa usada; 15 pantalones D. hombre, 15 camisas manga larga, 15 polos manga larga, 10 polos manga corta, 10 pantalones para mujer, 10 blusas manga larga, 5 vestidos, 5 faldas largas, 6 polos para niños, 10 pantalones para niños, 10 chompas, 2 colchas, 4 shores, 6 vestidos para niñas.
La señora rosa está contenta con su negocio porque D. paso le sirve para relajarse por la chacra y eso lo hace cada 15 días.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por otorgarle los créditos que ella solicita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" communal bank in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali.  She is 65 years old and has 4 adult children.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Mrs. Rosa sells second-hand clothing.  She has been in the business for several years and enjoys what she does since it lets her earn a small income.

She plans to use the loan of 1,500 PEN to buy more second-hand clothing: 15 men's trousers, 15 long-sleeved shirts, 15 long-sleeved polo shirts, 10 short-sleeve polo shirts, 10 women's trousers,  10 long-sleeved blouses, 5 dresses, 5 long skirts, 6 children's polo shirts, 10 children's trousers, 10 sweaters, 2 bedspreads,  4 shorts, 6 girls' dresses   Mrs. Rosa is very happy with her business since it also lets her take relaxation classes very two weeks.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans she has received.

loans.use: TO BUY SECOND-HAND CLOTHING: 15 men's trousers, 15 long-sleeved shirts, 15 long-sleeved polo shirts, 10 short-sleeve polo shirts, 10 women's trousers,  10 long-sleeved blouses, 5 dresses, 5 long skirts, 6 children's polo shirts, 10 children's trousers, 10 sweaters, 2 bedspreads,  4 shorts, 6 girls' dresses

loans.name: Wanka Walashmika ("hombres Valerosos") Group

texts.es:
Mauricia P. C., 25 años de edad, conviviente, 02 hijos en edad escolar.
Mauricia pertenece al grupo comunal "Wanka Walashmika" (Hombres valerosos) que ella preside.
Mauricia desde muy joven aprendiò a cocinar al lado de su madre; quièn le enseñò todos los secretos en el arte culinario que aprendiò de su abuela. 
Mauricia actualmente se dedica a la preparaciòn de platos tìpicos de la regiòn donde vive.
El prèstamo solicitado lo invertirà en la compra de mesas y sillas de su negocio de comidas.
(En la fotografia, Mauricia viste de pantalon color verde y chompra color fuscia o rosado,, y es la segunda empezando la derecha)
texts.en:
Mauricia P. C. is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 school-age children.  She belongs to the "Wanka Walashmika" (Brave Men) community bank and she is the bank's president.

Maruicia learned to cook alongside her mother from a very early age.  Her mother taught her all the secrets of the culinary art that she learned from her grandmother.  Mauricia currently prepares dishes that are typical of her region.  She will invest her loan in buying tables and chairs for her meal business.  (In the photograph, Mauricia is wearing green pants and a fuchsia-colored cardigan.  She is the second person from the right).

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, del distrito de Calleria y departamento de Ucayali, tiene 56 años de edad y 3 hijos (dos mayores y uno que todavía está a su cargo).
La señora Hortencia tiene su negocio de venta de comida, todo asado en carbón, es un trabajo que no deja mucha ganancia pero le alcanza para sus gastos primarios y para poder seguir trabajando.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará una mesa de 2 metros y 2 bancas grandes, 1 mantel de plástico, 2 fuentes, ½ doc. De jarras de ½ litro de vidrio, y un paraguas grande para cuando llegue el invierno y otras pequeñas cosas que necesita.
La señora Hortencia quiere seguir trabajando para poder darle estudios a su hijo sin que le falte nada, porque el estudio es la única herencia que se puede dejar a su  hijo y dice que lo va lograr gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Supportive Women) community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old and has three children (two are grown up and one is still in her care). 

Hortencia's business is selling fire-roasted food.  It is work that doesn't make much profit but it makes enough to cover all her basic needs and enough that she is able to continue working.  

Hortencia will use this new loan for 2,300 Peruvian soles to buy a 2 meter-long table and 2 large benches, 1 plastic tablecloth, 2 dishes, half a dozen 1/2 liter glass pitchers, a large umbrella for the winter and some other small things that she needs.

Hortencia would like to continue working so that she can provide her son with an education without him wanting for anything.  An education is the only inheritance she has to leave her son and she says that she will achieve it thanks to Manuela Ramos

loans.use: To buy a 2 meter-long table, 2 large benches, 1 plastic tablecloth, 2 dishes, half a dozen 1/2 liter glass pitchers and a large umbrella for the winter

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: Ayde tiene 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de su hijo. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender productos de segunda mano como ropa, muebles  entre otros artículos, en la feria comercial de su ciudad, sus padres le enseñaron a vender estos productos y en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Desde entonces cada fin de semana, se abastece de mercadería, en donde se dedica a recolectar cualquier producto en desuso para luego llevarlos a vender. Por otro lado, vende algunos artículos agrícolas como semillas y fertilizantes, en donde viaja a zonas rurales para ofrecerlos a los campesinos. Considera  que la venta de artículos usados es más rentable porque le genera buenas ganancias y en adelante desea seguir trabajando en este negocio y adquirir más puestos de venta. Es su crédito numero 13 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en artículos en desuso.
texts.en:
Ayde is 29 years old and lives in her parents' home with her parents and her son.  She has been selling second-hand goods such as clothes, furniture and other products for more than three years in her local market.  Her parents taught her to sell these products and it is currently her main source of income.  Every weekend she stocks up with merchandise.  She collects any used products that she can later sell.

Ayde also sells agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.  She travels to rural areas to sell them to farmers.  She considers selling second-hand goods to be the most profitable business.  It makes her good profits.  In the future, she would like to continue working in this business and acquire more sales locations.

This is Ayde's 13th loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always proven herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more used products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more used products

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia Y. Ramírez  desde hace 3 años  cuenta un negocio de abarrotes y gorditas denominado “Ofelia”, este se encuentra en su misma casa para estar al pendiente de sus hijos y tareas domesticas. Como su negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco ella desea invertirle en productos para tener mejores ganancias y a futuro poner un losa en su lugar.
texts.en: For the past three years, Ofelia Y. Ramírez has had a business selling groceries and 'gorditas' (thick, filled tortillas).  Her business is called "Ofelia" and is located in her home so that she can also look after her children and her housework.  As her business has gradually prospered, she would like to invest in some products so that she can make better profits and, in the future, install stone flooring.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señoa. Martha T. es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en la comunidad de Shisquing en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señora. Martha tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como aserrador y tienen su casa  propia  que  fue construida con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal.

Doña Martha se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que tiene que estar al cuidado de su familia, en su casa  cría gallinas y cuyes  que los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad  y también son para su consumo. Ella también le ayuda a su esposo en el aserradero.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 6 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el negocio de su esposo, van a comprar  un bosque para preparar la madera y luego venderla en los depósitos. 

Su meta es darles a sus hijos una buena educación  para que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha T. is a member of the Más que Vencedoras [More than Winners] community bank. She lives in the community of Shisquing in the city of Azogues. This city is known for its beauty, which is a mixture of colonial and modern. Its people are kind and cordial. 

Martha is 29 years old, married and has 4 children aged 14, 12, 9 and 6. Her two oldest children are in high school and the youngest are in an elementary school in town. Her husband works as a sawyer and they own their own house built with the couple's hard work and sacrifice.  

Martha works in the home and she has to take care of her family. In her house she raises chickens and guinea pigs that she sells when she needs to and they are also for consumption. She also helps her husband in his job as a sawyer. 
 
She has been in the community bank for 6 years and she likes it as she has very good friends. She will use the money from the loan to invest in her husband's business. They are going to buy some trees to prepare the lumber and then sell it at the warehouses.   

Her goal is to give her children a good education so that they can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy some trees (wood).

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. N. y su esposo desde hace 23 años se dedican al negocio sobre ruedas, en este momento su mayor afición es a la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos es por ello que desean invertir mas en el para seguir prosperando. Margarita se ven en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada ya que en Diciembre tuvo muchas ventas.
texts.en: For the past 23 years, Margarita R. N. and her husband have had a business on wheels.  Right now, their main passion is selling used clothes, shoes and household products.  This business is their only source of income and they would like to invest in it so that it continues to prosper.  Margarita needs to request a loan so that she can buy seasonal clothing since she made a lot of sales in December.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Elsa H. es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en Bibilian que  pertenece a la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza  que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señorita  Elsa tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de su hermana donde comparte los gastos, la casa de su hermana es propia.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante de todo tipo de ropa actividad que la realiza hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes, vende su mercadería recorriendo la ciudad y sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su primer crédito y fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa y así surtir más su mercadería. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Elsa H. is a member of the Más que Vencedoras [More than Winners] community banks. She lives in Bibilian, which belongs to the city of Azogues. This city is known for its beauty, which is a mixture of colonial and modern. Its people are kind and cordial.  

Elsa is 28 years old, single, and lives in her sister's house where she shares expenses. Her sister owns the house. 
 
Our member is a merchant of all types of clothing. She has been doing this activity for 3 years. She works from Monday through Friday. She sells merchandise on the streets and has no set schedule.  
 
This is her first loan, and she was invited to be a part of the community bank by her sister. The money from the loan will be invested in buying more clothes and thus diversify her merchandise. Her goal is to grow her business more.

loans.use: To buy all types of clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria Suárez V. y su esposo cuentan con negocio de la venta de hamburguesas el cual tiene un año establecido. La venta la realiza los día Jueves, Viernes, Sábados y Domingos ya que son lo días qua mas se vende su producto. La pareja atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad  y limpieza pues este negocio es una fuente más de ingreso para el sostén familiar. El crédito que solicita es para comprar producto para elaboración de su venta.
texts.en: Victoria Suárez V. and her husband have a business selling hamburgers, which has been established for one year.  They sell their food on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, as these are the days when business is busiest.  The pair tends to their customers with friendliness and cleanliness, since this enterprise is what generates the income to support the family.  The loan they are requesting is for the purchase of the necessary ingredients to make the food they sell.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis Pérez Ávila es un hombre  muy trabajador, desde hace un año se dedica al transporte urbano como chofer de taxi, llevando a sus clientes a su destino por un bajo costo. Para tener mejores ganancias el trabaja día y noche de esta manera ayuda a su esposa con los gastos del hogar. Es padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar una nueva unidad para seguir ofreciendo su servicio.
texts.en: José Luis Pérez Ávila is a hard-working man who for the past year has been dedicated to working as a city taxi driver, transporting customers to their destinations for a low price.  In order to generate more income, he works days and nights to help his wife with the household expenses.  He is the father of two young children, for whom he tries to get ahead and wants to be able to provide them with a higher standard of living.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a new unit in order to continue offering his services.

loans.use: To purchase a transportation unit.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Flor M. es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

Doña Flor tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es profesional en mecánica y tiene un taller propio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Flor labora en el taller de su esposo de lunes a viernes, también tiene su propio negocio, ella vende productos de hierbalife y ropa por catálogo, esta actividad  la realiza desde hace 6 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos hierbalife y también en repuestos para vehículos. Su meta es crecer mas en su negocio en especial en la venta de productos de herbalife.
texts.en:
Flor M. is a member of the “More than Victorious” cooperative bank.  She lives in the city of Azogues, known for its beauty and its mix of modern and colonial elements.  The residents are very friendly and cordial.

Flor is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children ages 18, 16, 9 and 7.  Her first child, a son, is a student.  Her second, a daughter, is married and living independently.  Her two youngest children study at a local school.  Her husband is a mechanic and has his own workshop.  They do not own their home but, instead, are renting.

Flor works in her husband’s workshop Mondays through Fridays.  She also has her own business selling Hierbalife products as well as clothing by catalog, an activity she has carried out for 6 years.

She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 6 years, and plans to invest the funds from her loan into buying Hierbalife products as well as car replacement parts.  Her goal is to see her business grow, especially her Hierbalife products sales.

loans.use: To purchase Hierbalife products as well as car replacement parts.

loans.name: Llenitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Llenitas de Amor, debido a que tienen mucho amor a su negocio. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el pueblo de Mexicltzingo, se llama así ya que cuenta la historia que el aguila se paro primero ahi y significa México chiquito, el grupo esta coformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Silvia V. D. es una de las integrantes del grupo tiene 35 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 9 y 7 años, uno de sus hijo quiere ser piloto aviador y ella quiere poder brindarle la carrera, por eso cuida mucho su negocio le invierte y trabaja todos los días, lleva 12 años dedicandose a la produccion y venta de chicharron, comenzó con un puesto heredado por su madre ya que fue ella la que le enseño el oficio, ahora cuenta con dos puestos que miden metro y medio cada uno, en uno de ellos la apoya su marido los sábados y domingos ademá de trabajar de lunes a viernes, la señora quiere darle carrera a todos sus hijos para que tengan un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Llenitas de Amor” (Filled with Love) because they have a lot of love for their business.  The group is located in the town of Mexicaltzino whose meaning derives from the tale that the eagle alighted here first and it means “Little México.”  The group has 10 members.

Mrs. Silvia Vázquez D. is one of the members.  She’s 34 years old, married and has four children who are 12, 10, 9 and 7 years of age.  One of her children wants to be a Pilot and she wants to provide him with this career so she cares for her business with dedication investing in it and working every day.  

She has been making and selling chicharrones (fried pork skin) for 12 years.  She started out with a stand passed down from her mother since she taught her everything about the occupation.  Now she has two stands measuring a meter and a half each.  Her husband helps her in one of them on Saturdays and Sundays after working all week from Monday through Friday.  She wants to provide careers to all her children so that they will have better life styles.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the fried pork.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: El señor José Santos J. Marin  desde hace 3 años se dedica al transporte escolar, esta es la manera que el percibe un ingreso para abastecer los gastos de su familia. El camión donde trabaja y traslada al estudiante esta fallando es por ello que el pide el apoyo para darle mantenimiento para que este en mejores condiciones. José quiere dar un mejor servicio y así poder tener más ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Santos J. Marin has driven a school bus for the past 3 years, which is how he generates income to support his family.  The van that he uses for his work transporting students is failing.  He is requesting support so that he can make some repairs so that it will be in better condition.  José wants to be able to provide an excellent level of service, so he can augment his income and offer his family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To make repairs to his mode of transportation.

loans.name: Isabel Karina

texts.es:
Isabel de 35 años, es una microempresaria que con esfuerzo ha podido durante años agrandar el negocio que comenzó con poco capital. 

Tiene un negocio de venta de helados al por mayor. También dando helados por litros a los vendedores de helados ambulantes. Poco a poco ha incrementado su capital de trabajo y ha comprado maquinas para una mayor producción (aparase en la foto una de sus maquinas). Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con la ayuda de una de sus amigas.       

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo una maquina industrial que bate helados. En el futuro desea agrandar el negocio y tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Isabel, 35 years of age, is a small business owner who, with a great deal of effort over the years, has been able to grow the business she started with a small amount of capital.

She has an enterprise selling ice cream at wholesale.  She also provides ice cream by the liter to the street vendors.  Little by little, she has increased her working capital and bought machinery to increase her production (as shown in the picture).  She works from 8:30 am until 6:00 pm every day, along with help from one of her friends.

She has many aspirations for her business, which is why she would like to use this loan to purchase an industrial machine that churns ice cream.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and have other locations.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial machine.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Este señor es maestro del instituto señor de esquipulas de telica, donde labora desde el año 2007, con 4 años de desempeñar dicha labor, es casado , originario del poblado de san jacinto a unos 6 kilometros del poblado de telica, sus padres son agricultores de la zona, esfuerzos que le dieron para la superacion academica que hoy obstenta y que le permite tener otro nivel de vida, ya que con la empresa es el Segundo financiamientio que recibe, y que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida, fruto ya  de su esfuerzo, y que lo esta aprovechando con el apoyo de los financiamientos  pequeños de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a teacher at Señor de Esquipulas School in Telica.  He has been in his job for 4 years, since 2007.  He is married and from the town of San Jacinto, 6 kilometers from the town of Telica.  His parents are local farmers who worked hard so that he could improve himself academically.  This has enabled him to enjoy a better standard of living.

This is his second loan.  Through his previous loan, and his hard work, he has been able to improve his living conditions.  He is taking advantage of the support of these small loans which are given in accordance with his ability to repay.

loans.use: To buy beams, bricks and cement

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La señora Blanca Rosa es madre de 2 niñas, hace tiempo su esposo falleció por lo que se vio obligado por las circunstancias que quedo a tener una mejor opción. A pesar del dolor que estaba pasando siguió adelante y puso un negocio que es una papelería y mercería llamada “Angelique”con 3 años de antigüedad. Blanca ofrece a sus clientes variedad de artículos escolares a un bajo precio, pero en este momento requiere de un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa has two children.  Her husband passed away some time ago.  Therefore, she had no choice under the circumstances.  She had to have a better alternative.  In spite of the pain she was going through, she kept going.  

She established a business, a stationery and general merchandise store called Angelique.  She has had the store for three years.

Blanca offers her customers a variety of school items at a low price.  She now needs a loan to be able to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Cazadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  LAS CAZADORAS, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, decidieron ponerle ese nombre ya que cuenta la historia que el lugar que hoy ocupa este municipio ere favorable para la caza y recolección en la epoca prehispanica, tal y como lo dice su nombre. En el cerro del Chapulin está integrado por 11 miembros una de ellas es la señora Patricia G., tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, antes de iniciar con su negocio se dedicaba exclusivamente al hogar pero la necesidad y las ganas de salir adelante la llevo a buscar nuevas fuentes de ingreso, con los ahorros que contaba decidierón poner una Miscelanea, la cual ha sido el sustento de su familia, la ilusion de la señora es que un día sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y que estudien ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad para desarrolllarse como una gran profesionista, con el crédito que la institucion le ha otorgado desea, adquirir más mercancia para que su negocio crezca y algún día poder contar con un minisuper que le permita tener una tranquilidad para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “LAS CAZADORAS” (The Huntresses) and is located in the state of México.  They decided on this name because legend has it that the place this town now sits on was once favorable for hunting and gathering during the Pre-Hispanic era, just like its name indicates.  It is in Cerro del Chapulín and has 11 members.

One of the members is Mrs. Patricia González.  She has three children who are 15, 11 and 3 years of age, respectively.  Before starting her business she was exclusively a housewife but need and the desire to get ahead led her to seek new sources of income.  With saving she had they decided to open a general store which has been her family’s support.  Her dream is that her children have a better quality of life some day and that they go to school since she never had the opportunity to develop as a great professional.

With the loan the institution grants her she wants to acquire more merchandise so that her business will grow and someday she’ll be able to open a minisupermarket that will give her and her family tranquility.

loans.use: For groceries and furniture for her store.

loans.name: Savina Del Rosario

texts.es: Esta señora es la delegada del MINED municipal de telica, donde tiene de laborar 22 años, iniciandose como maestro, hasta obstentar el cargo que hoy representa, es casada madre de 2 hijos, los cuales estudian en la UCAN leon el Tecnico Lasalle de la misma cuidad, convive con su marido y sus hijos, es originaria de la comarca Rigoberto Morales Chavez a tan solo ½ KM de el poblado de telica carretera leon san isidro, sus padres son agricultores de la zona , dichos esfuerzos de los mismos para darle la preparacion academica, que tiene, y legado que esta aprovechando para transferirselos a sus hijos por el mejoramiento de la s condiciones de vida, ademas apoyado con los financiamientos obtenidos con la empresa, ha mejorado y sigue mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is the MINED (Ministry of Education) representative in the Telica municipality.  She has worked there for 22 years.  She started as a teacher and worked until she got the position that she now has.  She is married and has two children.  The children attend school at UCAN (Autonomous Christian University of Nicaragua) el Técnico Lasalle in the city of Leon.

She lives with her husband and their children.  She is from the Rigoberto Morales Chavez region, which is ½ of a kilometer from the town of Telica on the San Isidro highway to Leon.  Her parents are farmers in the zone.  Through their hard work they gave her the academic preparation and legacy that she has.  She is taking advantage of this to pass it on to her children in order to improve their living conditions.

Supported by the loans she got with the business, she has improved and continues to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay university registration and module fees

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es: La señora Nohemí Álvarez Sánchez cuenta con negocio desde hace 2 años denominado  “Miscelánea la Esquina”  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos. La señora recurre a esta institución para pedir apoyo para surtir su negocio y así obtener más ganancias para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia. Nohemí tiene tiene un niño y uno que viene en camino por los que desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nohemí Álvarez Sánchez has had a business called “Miscelánea la Esquina” (The Corner General Store).  She sells her customers general groceries like snacks and soft drinks.

Nohemí comes to this institution to request support to stock her business.  This way she will get more income and be able to keep up with the family expenses.  Nohemí has one child and one on the way.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: To stock her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Jaime

texts.es: El señor Juan Jaime G. G. solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar su vivienda; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina y su techo se esta deteriorando. Juan Jaime quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos el trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y su esposa se queda tiempo extra para tener un ingreso mayor.
texts.en: Juan Jaime G. G. is requesting a loan to waterproof his house because when it rains the water seeps inside and his roof is deteriorating.  Juan Jaime would like to prevent this problem from becoming worse so that he doesn't end up having to spend even more money.  In order to cover his expenses, Juan Jaime works in a cross-border assembly plant from Monday to Friday.  His wife works overtime in order to earn more money.

loans.use: To waterproof his home

loans.name: Denisse Yumey

texts.es: La Sra. Denisse Yumey M. C. vive con su hijo en la casa de sus padres. La vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Santiago. La Sra. Denisse se dedica a la venta de postres que ella mismo realiza. Tambien tiene un ingreso de una mototaxi que alquila diariamente. Su sueño segun nos comenta es incrementar el negocio y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Denisse Yumey M. C. lives with her son in her parents' home which is located in Santiago district.  Denisse makes and sells desserts.  She also makes income from a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers and/or cargo) that she hires out daily.  She tells us that her dream is to increase her business and thereby be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She is very grateful for the support that we are able to give her with this loan.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita M. Domínguez cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 año todos los fines de semana, este es su fuente de ingresos al cual desea invertir; para seguir generando mas ganancias. Margarita se intereso en el apoyo que se brinda en esta institución para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Señora Margarita M. Domínguez has been running a business selling used clothing at weekends for the last year. Her only income comes from this business and she wishes to invest in it so that she can earn more money. Margarita is interested in securing a loan from Kiva partner Credituyo so that she can add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Pimpoyas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama las Pimpoyas, le pusieron este nombre en honor a la belleza femenima, se consideran una esencia natural de vida, este municipio pertenece al Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Yanet Micaela S. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 35 años, es casada, estudió una licenciatura en administración, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos una niña de 10 años y 1 varón de 7 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades por temporada que inicio desde hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en materia prima ya que así podrá realizar sus pedidos anticipandose a la temporada, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio. Sus clientes la recomiendan ampliamente, tanto, que le han solicitado servicios a domicilio en manualidades como es arreglos de mesa, regalos de temporada. La señora Yanet maneja muy buen estandar de venta. Al solicitar este préstamo ella se siente muy satisfecha y alegre ya que le da la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio. También espera ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y una buena educación, además de desarrollarse como mujer y madre.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Pimpoyas.  They chose this name in honor of feminine beauty, which is considered to be the natural essence of life.  This municipality belongs to the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  

The group is comprised of ten members.  Yanet Micaela S. is the president of the group.  She is 35, married, and studied for a degree in administration.  She is a merchant, and she has two children, a ten year old girl and a seven year old boy.  She sells seasonal handicrafts, which she started three years ago.  She is requesting the loan to get raw material.  Then she will be able to fill her orders by anticipating the season.  That way she will be able to offer better service.  She is so widely recommended by her customers that they request her handicraft services in their homes.  She does things like table arrangements and seasonal gifts.

Yanet manages a very good level of sales.  She feels very satisfied and happy upon requesting this loan.  It gives her the opportunity to make her business grow.  Also, she hopes to give her children a better quality of life and a good education in addition to growing as a woman and a mother.

loans.use: Invest in raw materials for seasonal handicrafts

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Corral de Arena ubicado en el  distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Alcira se dedica  a la venta de ganado ovino y caprino; ella cría el ganado en un ambiente situado en  su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente es propietaria de  un mototaxi.

Ella desea adquirir más ganado y alimento balanceado para alimentarlos adecuadamente y ofrecerlos a un buen precio para lograr ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alcira es una madre de familia bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
29-year old Alcira is married and lives with her family in the small village of Corral de Arena in the Olmos district. It is an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Alcira raises sheep and goats near her home and then sells them. She feeds them with local grasses, and when they have reached a good size, she sells them to businessmen who frequently visit the area. 

In addition, Alcira has a motortaxi.

She wishes to obtain more livestock and nutritionally balanced food so that she can sell the animals for a good price. Then she can expand her business and earn more money. For this reason she thought it was a good time to approach Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of 1500 soles to help her reach her goal. 

Alcira is a hardworking, diligent mother admired by those who know her for her desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and animal food

loans.name: Tungalagtuya

texts.en:
Tungalagtuya D., 35, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Now they live in a rented house. Her husband drives a taxi and her older daughter attends a local primary school. 

Tungalagtuya graduated from a vocational school as a cook after she finished high school in 1993. She opened a cafeteria at a local transportation center in 2007. Now she operates her cafe at a crowded location and her business has become more stable. 

Tungalagtuya is a sociable person who wants to expand her cafeteria. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to replace her kitchen tools and the furniture in her cafe.

loans.use: To buy new tables, chairs and kitchen tools

loans.name: Mrs. Hean Soknoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who make up a village bank loan live in Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their families. 

Mrs. Hean S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She owns a general shore in the local village where she sells groceries to get some profit to support her family. She also is a pig breeder. 

Her husband, Mr. Sroun Kong, is a motorbike taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. Through this activity, they support two children, one of whom is a student. The younger one is 2 years old.

Since her businesses are getting on well, Mrs. Hean S. wants to expand, so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries and the rest of the loan she is going use to buy more pig food.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Mrs. Lon Y. was born in 1966 and she lives in Preaek Ta In village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Uon Thy, are farmers who own a plot that they use to cultivate rice to support their family. The couple has four children: one of whom is a soup seller, one is a laborer, and one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the youngest child is two years old. 

Mrs. Lon Y. would like to request a loan to buy a water machine and rice seeds to support their rice farming.  She will use the remaining loan funds to buy two piglets for breeding.  Mr. Uon Thy also works as a fisherman, a job in which he earns a little additional income to support his family. The couple is together in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and rice seeds for growing rice.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta T. is 61 years old and from the village of Sto. Niño, Tampilisan Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two adult children. Ernesta owns and operates a business venture running a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Ernesta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Ernesta joined Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesta has successfully repaid a previous PMPC loan of 5000 PHP. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Ernesta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the third loan Ernesta has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her service-based business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: The group requesting this loan is made up of five members from the Samchat village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chantha C. is the group leader and has been selected by the group to use the other members’ portions of the loan to improve her family’s living situation. Mrs. C. and her husband, Mr. Kun Ek, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell in support of their family.   Mrs. C. also sells blankets and scarves in the local village, earning some profit to support her family.  They have three children: one of whom is a farmer, while the others attend the local public school.  Though they try to work hard, Mrs. C. and Mr. Ek earn little income.  Mrs. C. requests a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding so she can start a new business.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan S. is a 24-year-old married woman who lives in the Spean Daek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheoum Vichay, earn their living by fishing.  They have one child who is 6 years old and not in school. Mrs. S.'s husband is in the picture with her.   

Mrs. S. would like to request a loan to support her fishing.  Aside from farmer, she also earns a living by selling groceries. With their carriers, they are able to earn a little income to support their family.

loans.use: To support her fishing.

loans.name: Ann Marie

texts.en:
Ann Marie G. is 28 years old and from the village of Tuburan,Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two infant children. Ann Marie owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ann Marie joined Kiva partner Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann Marie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in speciality retail store

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Mrs. Duk S. is a 31-year-old married woman, and she is a villager who lives in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. 
She and her husband, Mr. Soun Sun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow vegetables and rice to support their family. Besides farming, Mr. Soun Sun also earns his living by selling water.

This couple has three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

In order to support their businesses, Mrs. Duk S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to water the rice plants. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a trailer and a small container to support her husband's other business. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai G., 41, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Tuv province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Her husband is self-employed. Her older daughter goes to college and her younger daughter attends a local high school. 

Bayarmagnai graduated from vocational school in 1991 and worked as a tailor and quality control specialist in the garment industry between 1997 and 2007. 

In 2006 she opened her own tailoring shop. She wants to expand her business and start manufacturing clothes. Bayarmnagnai's future dream is to open her own garment factory. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Keut

texts.en:
From the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, Keut N. is 41 years of age and currently works as a repairman in a motor company. 

Keut N. has a life partner in his wife, who works as a sewing worker in industry. 

The couple has three teenage children. One is no longer in school and is working in construction, and the remaining two are students. 

Keut N. always uses his motorbike to ride to his workplace. He is concerned because it breaks down very often. He really wants to change to a new one, but his cash on hand is not sufficient to make it possible.
