loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Nget M. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. Nget M. was married but her husband died years ago. She stays at home to do housework and take care of her family. Nget M. says that she depends on the income from her daughter and son-in-law who are garment factory workers, and earn a monthly salary. 

Nget M. has been repairing her old house but hasn't had the money to finish it yet. To solve this problem, Nget M. is asking for a loan of $700 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to finish fixing her house.

loans.use: To make final repairs on her old house.

loans.name: Sharapat's Group

texts.en:
Sharapat M., 52, is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Uzgen, an ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan near Osh. Unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two daughters, both of whom work in the hospital. In order to earn money to meet her personal needs, Sharapat farms agricultural products. She earns 2000 soms per month by selling part of the harvest. She saves money but also needs an additional amount to purchase a piece of land to expand her farm. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Malaika Group

texts.fr: Furaha H.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Malaika, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Son conjoint  l’assiste dans s son business.  Furaha H.  est  vendeuse de braises,elle s’ installe dans un dépôt d’exposition de grossistes.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari d’une valeur 300$. Depuis 2000, elle exerce cette activité.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (57 sacs des braises).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et voir ses enfants finir leurs études. La cliente Furaha H. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Malaika est constitué de 13 membres, bien habillés confortablement avec  l’uniforme d’unité.
texts.en:
H. Furaha is an entrepreneur and leader of the Malaika business group. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of six children. Her spouse assists her in her business.

H. Furaha sells charcoal in a depot where wholesalers display their goods. She started her business with her own funds, $300 supplied by her husband. She has been running her business since 2000.

Later she benefited from a $50 credit loan from the Hekima MFI. This new loan will serve to resupply her merchandise (57 bags of charcoal). Moreover her ambition is to expand her business and see her children complete their education.

As a customer H. Furaha thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to impoverished people who are excluded from normal banking services. The Malaika group is made up of 13 members, comfortably dressed in their unit’s uniform.

loans.use: 57 bags of charcoal

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Theresa Cherop

texts.en:
Theresa Messes is 49 years old and married to Joseph Singoei, a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 17 years and 14 years old. Theresa runs a cereals shop in Kaboen trading centre in Kapsabet town. She sells maize, beans and cow peas. She has been primarily in this business for a period of five years and her monthly profits is KES 15,000. 

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more assorted cereals so as to improve her business. She has borrowed a loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD this being her fourth loan and she successfully completed her previous loans. She will use this amount to purchase maize for resale KES 30,000 and tea leaves for KES 15,000. Her future hopes and dreams is to expand her business and also educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: Purchase assorted cereals to sell.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo T. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 62 years old. Raymundo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Raymundo owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling soap products to local businesses and community members. Raymundo is just starting this business.

In 2007, Raymundo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raymundo has successfully repaid a previous loan of from GDMPC. This previous loan was used  to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Raymundo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Raymundo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda I. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Yolanda is just starting this business.

In 2011, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is 44 years old and is married with one child who is 16 years old.  Nada has been running a restaurant for the past five years and she employs four people.  Her restaurant is open from 6am to 8pm.  Nada realized she needed more equipment and food stocks to help improve her business and is taking her first loan from VFC to help her expand.

Nada will use any added profits she makes from her improvements to reinvest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more food and equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en:
Valeh M. is from Azerbaijan. This 56-year-old man lives in Imishli. He is married and the father of three sons and one daughter. All of them are adults and married. Valeh has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business since 2002, and during these nine yeas this business was the only financial source for the family. He also grows poultry for family use. 

There were two cows in Valeh's farm but it was not enough to cover all the needs of a growing family. That is why he requested his first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 2000 AZN to buy four more cows, so as to increase the number of cows to six and boost his profit. He works at the business for 5-6 hours per day. He is a very responsible and diligent man. 

Valeh plans expand his dairy and meat sales and increase the number of cows up to 11, in the future.

loans.use: to buy four cows

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
Memia S. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Memia is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Memia owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling products to local businesses and community members. Memia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Memia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Memia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Memia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Memia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
The man appearing in the picture above, Nhim S., age 30, resides in a village located near Phnom Penh city. He currently owns a truck that he uses to provide transport service for a fee. He has a partner in his wife who stays at home to do housework. The couple married a few years ago, but they do not have a child yet. 

From the business, Nhim S. is able to generate an average of US$ 10 per day to cover family expenses. Recently, his truck has often broken down and his income has also been affected. That why Nhim S. is applying for a loan to be used to mend his broken-down truck.

loans.use: To mend his broken-down truck

loans.name: De's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen members. They are located in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province.

Mrs. De E. was born in 1953, and she is the village bank president. She has been selected to be the village bank president by the eighteen members. She and her husband are fishermen who are able to earn a little income to support their family. They do not have enough fishing equipment to support their business. So, Mrs. De E. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing equipment. Aside from being a fisherman, she also earns her living by breeding pigs at her home. 

These spouses are working at their businesses to support their five children: four are fishermen and one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Tamara's Group

texts.en:
Tamara M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, an ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan near Osh. She is 57 and married to a bookkeeper. Together they have raised two children: a son and a daughter. The son, 33, is handicapped and the daughter, 18, works in a bank. In order to earn additional money, Tamara cultivates agricultural products. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase wheat for cultivating. In the near future, Tamara plans to celebrate her son’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat

loans.name: Haem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Haem D. is the group leader who has been selected by the four members who make up this group loan. Each will use her portion of the loan to improve the family's living standards. They are located in Thnoas village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Haem D. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Ngos Sek, is a fisherman and a cow middleman. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So Mrs. Haem D. is asking for a loan to buy rice for resale to start a new business. This couple is bringing up three children who are all students.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 36 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old.  Alphonsine sells a variety of goods and food in her store such as bread, sugar, rice, toothpaste and lotion. 

She is in this business for four years.  The hours of her business are from 6am to 9pm every day.  She is a hard worker and she currently employs one person to help her.  Alphonsine has requested a loan in order to upgrade and expand her store.  With any profit, Alphonsine will buy some property on which to build her own house.

loans.use: To upgrade and expand her store.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is married with five sons. He lives and runs his farming business in the town of Vodyanoye. Volodya grows early spring vegetables, e.g., tomatoes, radishes, peppers, and cucumbers. His whole family is actively involved in this business. Volodya has been running this venture for twenty years and has invested 30,000 Grivnyas himself. His expenses for seeds and polyethylene film amount to 26,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Volodya loves working in this industry. He is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to construct three new greenhouses. Additional greenhouses will provide space for growing more agricultural produce, thus providing extra income for Volodya and his family.

loans.use: To construct additional greenhouses.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married with a teenage son. Edward is a farmer from Kamenka where he grows early spring tomatoes in greenhouses. He owns four plots of land where he has 18 big greenhouses. Edward plants 26,000 tomatoes every year. He has been working in agriculture for ten years. He loves his job and invests all his time in it. Edward has already invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. 

Edward is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase good quality tomato seeds. Quality seeds will produce a harvest of tomatoes with a pleasing combination of sweetness, flavor and a smooth texture. A high sales rate will help Edward generate additional income that will be reinvested to install heating systems in all of his greenhouses. In addition to his farming business, Edward also runs a small summer café next to a local highway which brings him extra income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim R. is married and lives with his wife and three children in Saatli, a province of Azerbaijan. His wife takes care of their children and the household. The children, two daughters and one son, go to a local secondary school. In 2006 Nazim decided to open an electrical goods store. After some years of successful operations he has been able to increase his working capital. 

Nazim's trading business has also grown, thanks to his first loan with AqroInvest. He has been able to improve his living situation and better support his children. Actually this is the main goal of his life. His current monthly income is around 250 AZN. After successfully repaying the previous loan, he is now requesting a new one for 1600 AZN to be used as working capital to purchase new electrical goods. Nazim and his family are very thankful to AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical goods

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two daughters. She lives in the small agricultural town of Vodyanoye. Galina grows early spring vegetables, i.e., tomatoes and radishes. She owns eight big greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. Both greenhouses for seedlings have gas heating systems. Galina has been in this business for fourteen years. She has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this venture. Her expenses for seeds and polyethylene film amount to 38,000 Grivnyas every year. 

Galina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds for the upcoming planting season. The timely transplanting of quality seeds will help her grow a good harvest and receive additional income. One of Galina’s other business plans is to install heating systems in the rest of her greenhouses.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Samson Manthi

texts.en:
Samson Manthi K. has been operating a retail shop in Emali town for a period of 10 years. He also does crop farming. He earns a profit of KES 20,000. He is married to Janet and they have two school-aged children.

He learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in Emali town. He is applying for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use purchase more stock for his shop and also to pay for the shipping costs of these items to the shop.

Samson plans to use the anticipated profits to open an oil filling station. In the future, he plans to expand his business, to educate his children, and to buy a lorry for his business. He is hardworking businessman and a good planner.

loans.use: To increase the stock of the shop, and pay transport.

loans.name: C4704 Twiyarure Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and married with two children. Emmanuel is the president of a group called 'Twiyarure'. He is pictured above in the black shirt on the left.  He owns a restaurant and he has been in this business for about ten years. The restaurant is open from 5AM until 9PM every day. He currently employs four people.  

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more equipment and food for the restaurant. He plans to use the profits to pay school fees and continue to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Additional food and equipment for the restaurant.

loans.name: Ivarat's Group

texts.en:
Ivarat A., 58, is the leader of this group.  She is a resident of Tup, a small village in Isykul region.  Unfortunately she is a widow.  She has raised two sons and a daughter.  The sons are employed and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family. 

In order to earn money to meet her personal needs Ivarat breeds livestock.  She started three years ago with an initial investment of 4,000 KGS.  Reselling livestock animals after fattening at the higher price, she earns 2,000 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two bull-calves for breeding.  In the future Ivarat wants to enlarge a shed to be able to keep more livestock there.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase bull-calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a bale of clothes to add onto his inventory for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy goats for retail

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 26 years old and is not married.  Jeannette sells beans and she employs two people to help her.  She has four years' experience in this business.  The hours of her work are from 6.30am to 6pm every day except the weekends. 

This is Jeanette's second loan through Kiva. Jeannette is very determined and has requested this loan in order to buy a new product such as sorghum.  With any profit, she will be able to save in the future for building her own house.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Fiacre

texts.en:
Fiacre is 29 years old and is married with two children, 3 months and 3 and a half years old. Fiacre's wife also works in commerce.  Fiacre has owned his business for one year. It is a large and clean shop where he sells shoes. Fiacre is a hard worker who employs one other person. Fiacre keeps his shop open from 7am to 6pm every day except Saturday. 

Fiacre has requested a loan in order to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar K. is a 44-year-old man. He is married and lives with his wife and one adult son, who works as a construction worker at a local company. Both Anvar's daughters are married. Anvar is from Saatli and operates a home appliances store. He started this line of business in 2004. With the help of this business he is able to cover all family expenses. Now the monthly income of the family is around 300 Azeri manats. 

He is a diligent person who tries to work 10-12 hours per day to improve his family's well-being and to improve his business. With this cause in mind, he requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN. This is his first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. He used the loan to purchase new inventory and electrical goods for his store. Anvar is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to repay the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more music discs and cassettes

loans.name: Umutkan's Group

texts.en:
Umutkan D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. She is 37 and married to a builder. Together they are bringing up three sons; the first son is at school and the other two are not yet. In order to earn money to cover the family budget, Umutkan takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national clothes, carpets and pillows. She started five years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now she earns 10,000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials needed for sewing. In the future she wants to increase the turnover of her business up to 50,000 soms.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more baby blankets, powder and soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and ladies' underclothes

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: Kabuo V.  est entrepreneur,leader du groupe d’affaire Utulivu, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants.  Son conjoint  est enseignant.  Kabuo V.  est  vendeuse de boissons (Primus, Fanta). Elle vend également l’huile végétale, le savon Omo.  Elle fait aussi la coupe couture. Elle s’installe à son domicile et parfois dans la rue, le soir aux heures de pointe.  Elle  bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ pour démarrer son activité. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle est en action. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (3casiers de Primus, 2 casiers de Fanta, 1 bidon d’huile, 50kgs d’Omo, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, voir ses enfants finir leurs études et acheter une parcelle pour sa famille. La cliente Kabuo V. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Utulivu est constitué de 24 membres. Cependant deux clientes furent absentes lors de la prise de photo de groupe d’affaire notamment Tumsifu U. et Kavira K. O..
texts.en:
V. Kabuo is an entrepreneur and leader of the Utulivu business group. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Her spouse is a teacher.

V. retails beverages (Primus, Fanta), vegetable oil and Omo soap. She also is a tailor. She works from her home and sometimes in the street, in the evening during rush hour.

She was granted a $50 loan from Hekima to start up the activity she has been running for four years. This new loan will enable her to resupply her merchandise (3 cases of Primus, 2 cases of Fanta, 1 container of oil, 50 kilos of Omo, etc.). Additionally she wishes to expand her business, see her children complete their education, and buy a plot of land for her family.

As a customer V. thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to empoverished people who have no access to basic banking services. The Utulivu group is made up of 24 members. It should be noted that two members were absent at the business group’s picture-taking session: they are U. Tumsifu et K. O. Kavira.

loans.use: 3 cases of Primus, 2 cases of Fanta, 1 container of vegetable oil, 50 kilos of Omo, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: San Agustín Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Hjugua Hu de la ciudad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Rilcy Y., ella es una mujer muy correcta, honesta y trabajadora, Doña Rilcy viven con su marido, que también tiene un pequeño negocio, y sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres van a la escuela.
La Sra. Rilcy sale todos los días con su pequeño catálogo a ofrecer sus joyas, recorre varios barrios de Caacupé y también ciudades cercanas para vender sus productos.
Gracias a este programa ella cuenta con un pequeño capital para poder tener más productos para la venta y así poder generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Ella y todas sus compañeras del comité están muy contentas y agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo que les brinda através del Programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
texts.en: The women of the present committee are from the Hjugua company in the city of Caacupé.  The committee's president is Mrs. Rilcy Y..  She is an upstanding, honest, hard-working woman who lives with her husband, who also has a small-business, and her four children who are in school.  Mrs. Rilcy goes out everyday with her small catalog to sell jewelery.  She goes to various neighborhoods in Caacupé and also nearby cities to sell her products.  Thanks to this program, she can count on some capital so she can have more products to sell and generate more income for her and her family.  She, and all her friends in the group are very happy and grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they provide through the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras."

loans.use: To purchase earrings, bracelets, chains, medals, rings.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek G. was born in 1971 in Ijevan city. He is married and has two sons, both are students. Aghabek’s wife is disabled person.
For several years Aghabek worked as an engineer and since this year he is working with the police. 

Starting in 2010, Aghabek, simultaneously with his permanent job, has been growing plants in his own greenhouse and has also been beekeeping. In his greenhouse he raises watercress, coriander, green beans, etc., which he sells in the Ijevan market during the winter months. Thanks to incomes from all his occupations, Aghabek supports his family and pays for his son’s education. 

Aghabek is asking for a 600,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan to construct a new greenhouse, where he will grow cucumbers, tomatoes and hot peppers. His future income will help Aghabek to pay his son’s educational fees.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing staple foods for resale

loans.name: Awali Mukama Group-Jinja

texts.en: Badru L., 47, the operator of a taxi transportation business in Jinja for 22 years, belongs to Awali Mukama group-Jinja.   Badru, a happily married man with four children, was formerly in a poultry business.  Earning a monthly income of 300,000 shillings, he will use this loan to buy new tyres and other spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: The purchase of tyres and other spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a business selling kikois for the past year, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge Amina faces in her business is seasonality. She hopes to establish a boutique business in the future.  

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase 30 khangas (kikois) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to run her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 khangas (kikois) to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and has six children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest 5 months. Betty's husband is a policeman.

Betty owns a small store in which she sells soft drinks, water, and juices, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more juices, sodas, milk, and water. With the profits, she plans to buy household equipment, such as cups and saucepans.

loans.use: To buy more juices, sodas, milk, and water

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 30 years old, the mother of three children who are between the ages of 3 years and 20 months. The eldest child is in school, and her husband is a driver.
 
Chantal owns a shop in which she sells soap, rice, juices, and sugar. Chantal has done this business for four years. Chantal is requesting a loan in order to buy more items such as rice and soap to fill her shop. With the profits, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as soap and rice

loans.name: Zibula Attude Women's Group-Jinja

texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old B. Sarah is affiliated with Zibula Attude Women's Group-Jinja. She operates a three-year-old general merchandise retail shop in Maga Maga. To get established in this business, Sarah says she banked on savings from her poultry business. Sarah, who is happily married with four kids, says she also has a pub business. The retail business generates for her 100,000 shillings on a weekly basis, and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is the mother of three children and is 40 years old. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. Her husband is a lawyer, and all their children are in school.

Rose sells secondhand clothes, and with this business she has been able to buy a piece of land on which she wishes to build a house in the future. Rose is requesting a loan in order to buy more secondhand clothes, and with the profits she wishes to buy even more inventory.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Honoree

texts.en: Honoree, a 26-year-old single woman with no children, has a shop called Chez Giselle which sells a variety of goods including charcoal and new clothes. She also works in a bar. Honoree is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her charcoal business and plans to renovate her house with the additional profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal inventory.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josianne, 39 years old and married to a doctor, has five children ranging in age from 10 to 17 years. Josianne owns a shop that sells snacks such as cakes and biscuits. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more snacks and make more profits which she will reinvest into her enterprise. This business, together with her husband's earnings, has enabled her to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buying snacks to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine, 50 years old, has five children, all of whom are in school. Her eldest child was born in 1992, while the youngest was born in 2002.  Her husband works in house construction. Valentine, who owns a bar in which she sells local beer, is requesting a loan to buy more local beer, and plans to renovate her house with the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more local beer to sell.

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en: Tamari is a 39-year-old mother of four children ranging in age from 20 to 6 years, all in school.  Her husband is a driver. Tamari, who owns a restaurant in which she sells green bananas, rice, and other African dishes, is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs. With the additional profits she wishes to buy restaurant equipment. This business has helped Tamari pay her school fees, as she wants to sit for the secondary school final exams.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Concilie

texts.en: Concilie is 35 years old and has 3 children who range from the ages of 8 to 14 years of age. Concilie’s husband works in a hotel, and they work both work hard in order to provide their family with whatever they need. Concilie owns a small shop in which she sells various household items such as matches, sugar, and rice. Her business has enabled her to pay her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more household items. She plans to save all her profits in order to have enough capital to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: Buy more inventory of household items

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 25 years old, and his shop is called Amizero. He is single and very hardworking. Faustin owns a boutique in which he sells rice, flour, wheat and other foodstuffs. Faustin has done this business for 3 years, and it has enabled him buy his own motorcycle and a piece of land. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs and hence make more profits. Faustin plans to use his profits for his house construction.

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs for his shop.

loans.name: San Ramón Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Ramón de Punta del Este de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Norma G., vive con su marido y sus  hijos, ella trabaja como empleada doméstica y en su horas libres vende empanadas en su despensa.
Ella y sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el segundo ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en: The women of this communal bank are from the San Ramón de Punta del Este neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.  The president of the group is Señora Norma G..  She lives with her husband and children and works as a domestic employee.  In her free time she sells empanadas from her store.  She and her partners are very satisfied with the financial support from Fundación Paraguaya.  With the capital the women are expanding their businesses and  improving their quality of life.  The ten members of this group are in their second loan cycle.

loans.use: Baked goods, fruits and vegetables as well as expanding their businesses

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is 22 years old.  She is not yet married. She is focused and hard working. She sells used clothes. Nadine is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes so that she will earn more profits.  Nadine is planning to pay her school fees with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is 30 years old, she has 3 children, the youngest is 7 years old while the eldest is 11 years old. All her children are in school. Her husband is a retired soldier and he works with her. Scovia sells milk and has a butchery. This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family and pay school fees for her children. She is requesting for a loan in order to open up a canteen in which she plans to sell a variety of soft drinks and milk. She plans to lay a foundation for her new house.

loans.use: Buying items to sell in her Canteen.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with one child who is 37 years old. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food vending business and coconut selling for the past five years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  Asha faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of food for sale is low and the demand is high. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase building materials to renovate her food stall and add sacks of coconuts. Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her food stall and add sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Isidro Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Isidro reside en Yamabal, departamento de Morazán, tiene 43 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y la agricultura, su familia está compuesta por su esposa, sus hijas Adela de 15 años, Alejandra de 14 y su hijo Miguel de 11 años de edad, los jóvenes estudian.  Don Isidro trabaja todo el día en ocupaciones D. campo, en forraje, ordeño y cuido D. ganado, además D. trabajo de chapoda y siembra de maíz y frijol.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de alimento para el ganado (concentrado y forraje), este préstamo le sea muy útil, pues podrá adquirir la cantidad necesaria D. alimento para la época de verano, ya que el ganado depende D. alimento para que pueda dar leche abundante y esté en buenas condiciones.
Las aspiraciones son crecer en el negocio como ganadero, que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir, además de darle la educación a sus hijos y el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Don Isidro lives in Yamabal in the department of Morazán.  He is 43 years old and raises cattle and works in agriculture for a living.  His family is made up of his wife, his daughters Adela, 15, Alejandra, 14, and his son Miguel, 11. All of his children attend school.  Don Isidro works all day in the field feeding, milking and caring for his livestock, in addition to mowing and growing corn and beans.  

He needs a loan to purchase enough feed for his cattle (fodder and concentrate) to last the entire summer season since his cattle are dependent on the food for good milk production.  

His dreams are to grow his cattle business and for his family to have what they need to live, including an education for his children as well as daily sustenance.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed (fodder and concentrate)

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula tiene 47años. Es una señora con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Vive en su propia casa con 6 sus hijos. Todos los días su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano porque tiene que realizar la compra de sus productos y además empezar la elaboración de sus platillos. Desde hace 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad que es la venta de comida. Ella comenzó con una gran variedad de platillos para ofrecer a sus diferentes clientes. Ahora ella recurre a Fundación León 2000 para facilitarle un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo y así comprar frutas, verduras, aceite, carnes, gaseosas, jugos, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Juana Paula is a 47-year-old woman with an enterprising spirit. She lives in her own house with her 6 children. Every day, her job starts very early in the morning because she has to purchase her products and start making her dishes. She has been selling food for the last 18 years. She started out with a great variety of dishes to offer her patrons. She now turns to Fundación León 2000 for a loan that will be utilized as working capital so that she can buy fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, meats, soft drinks, juice, and other goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tekove Porâ Rekávo Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Blás de Rosado de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rafaela C., vive con sus hijos, ella trabaja vendiendo tortas, helados y todo tipo de comestibles, por ello solicita el crédito para aumentar su negocio.
Ella y sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
Las señoras  están en el primer ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this group all come from the San Blás de Rosado neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.

The group president is Ms. Rafaela C.. She lives with her two children and works selling sandwiches, ice cream, and all types of foodstuffs. She is requesting this loan in order to expand her business.

She and her fellow group members are very satisfied with the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have given them.

These women are in the first loan cycle with 10 group members.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream, drinks, fruit, bread, vegetables, dairy products, and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pork rinds, cheese, corn, and cladding

loans.name: Mwanamani

texts.en:
Mwanamina is a married woman with seven children, four of whom attend school, while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is paying school fees for her children.

For the past fourteen years, she has operated a retail shop, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanamina faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation, especially during rainy season. 

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 33 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años de edad, Carmen se dedica a la venta de Meriendas, tiene este negocio hace 8 años, lo atiende sola todos los días ya que de acá dependen los recursos con los que cuenta para ella y sus hijos. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería y productos de cocina como: maíz, leña, aceite, carnes y condimentos, dichos productos los necesita a diario para preparar los alimentos que exhibe a la venta para los clientes.
Su aspiración es ser una persona sobresaliente  en la vida, que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para poder desarrollarse como profesionales y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 33-year-old single mother who lives with her 3 children, ages 13, 8, and 2 in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután. Carmen sells lunches for a living, and she has been in business for 8 years. She runs this business on her own every day as she depends on it for the funds she needs for herself and her children.

She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise and kitchen products like corn, firewood, cooking oil, meats, and condiments, products she needs daily to prepare the meals she sells to her patrons.

Her aspiration is to be an outstanding person in life. She also hopes that her children will have what is necessary for them to become professionals, and she wants to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, cooking oil, meats, and condiments

loans.name: Babonere Kuiffe Women's Development Group-Jinja

texts.en:
Mary Pada N. is a 30 year-old, happily-married mother of 6.  She has been operating an agro-produce business for close to 5 years now. The advantage she has over other people engaged in the same business is that she has a peasant background. Mary harvests and sells cash crops from her own farming gardens at Jinja Food market. Weekly, this business generates her 50,000 shillings. 

With this loan, she says she is going to buy more manure for her farming gardens. Mary is part of the Babonere Kuiffe Women's Group Development in Jinja. In the photo one male group member's face is obscured.  One other male was not around when the photo was taken. Both are marked as unpictured. They are Shalif M. and Asadi T..

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her farming gardens

loans.name: Kancilida

texts.en:
Kancilida is 48 years old and she is a mother of 4 children. Her eldest child is 24 years, while the youngest is 11 years old. All her children are in school. 

Kancilida has a restaurant and sells clothes as well. She has done this business for 16 years, and she is proud of her work. Since her husband died she has been responsible for raising her family on her own. Kancilida is requesting a loan in order to buy more restaurant equipment and increase her capital. With the profits that she hopes to make, she plans to pay rent on her house.

loans.use: Buying restaurant equipment

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a clothing sales business (Khanga’s) for the past five years; he sells at the market and door too door to his neighbours. Suleiman faces a major challenge in high transportation costs. He hopes to expand his business and sell more products.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a bundle of clothes to start and stock a retail shop business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Maria Isila

texts.es:
María, D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Morazán, administra una tienda, vive con sus hijos D. 20, 16 y 13 años D. edad, María vive en casa D. su madre.
Este negocio lo inicio hace un año y medio, y sus hijas le ayudan a atender a los clientes. Actualmente María está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería y abastecer la tienda, mejorando su inventario y las posibilidades D. aumentar sus ventas.
Sueña con ver a sus hijas realizadas, con una carrera universitaria, que mejoren su calidad D. vida con un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
Maria is a 39-year-old woman who lives in her mother's home with her children, ages 20, 16, and 13 in the Jiquilisco department of Morazan. She runs a general store for a living.

She started this business a year-and-a-half ago, and her daughters help her attend to the customers. Maria is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise and re-stock the store, improving both the inventory and her possibilities of boosting sales.

She dreams to see her daughters obtain their college degrees, and hopes that they improve their quality of life with a different future.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her general store

loans.name: Mathius

texts.en: Mathius is 31 years old and has three children between the age of 7 years and 4 months. His two eldest children go to school. Mathius works together with his wife in the store they own, selling a variety of goods such as rice, sugar and soap. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more inventory. He also plans to renovate their house. With the profits he wishes to install electricity in his house.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jeanvier

texts.en: Jeanvier is 68 years old and has 8 children; her eldest was born in 1970 while her last was born in 1994. Jeanvier owns a store where she sells several items such as cooking oil, matches, soap and sugar. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She plans to save all her profits in order to build a house.

loans.use: Buy inventory of soap, cooking oil, and matches.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William de 36 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a vender maíz, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, William trabajaba anteriormente como motorista de buses, luego decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz, este negocio es el que cubre las necesidades del hogar.
Él actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz al por mayor, esta compra ayudara a tener más inventario y así mejorar sus ventas ya que dicha inversión al obtenerla por mayor cantidad también le darán buen precio como mayorista, quedándole por cada venta un margen de ganancia.
Su objetivo es trabajar por lograr una tienda fuerte, tener contactos de mayoristas, para crecer en el comercio, esperando aumentar cada vez más sus ventas, y velar por el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
William is a 36-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children, ages 10 and 8, in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután, selling corn for a living. William used to work as a bus driver, then decided to buy and sell corn. This is the business that covers the household expenses.
He is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase wholesale corn. This purchase will help him increase his inventory, thus boosting sales because buying the corn wholesale will leave him a margin of profit for every sale.
His goal is to work hard in order to strengthen his store, have wholesale contacts, and grow in the business sphere, hoping to increase his sales each time, and monitor his family's well-being.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Mwahuba

texts.en:
Mwahuba is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Mwahuba has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in high transportation costs.  She hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad y con 5 hijos, Antonio Z. C. quien desde hace 15 años era vendedor de dulces ambulantes en las afueras de un centro comercial de Medellín- Colombia. Sus ganas de superarse, de salir adelante y de ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia lo impulsaron a conseguir un local para ampliar su oferta de productos, estar en un lugar fijo y así aumentar sus ventas. 

Actualmente Antonio necesita de un préstamo para comprar más surtido para su tienda, pues hace poco su esposa enfrentó un embarazo riesgoso que le demandó altos costos, lo que lo descapitalizó su negocio. 

El sueño de este emprendedor a futuro es ampliar su negocio, ofrecer cada vez más productos para la canasta familiar y comprar una finca para cosechar diferentes hortalizas que también pueda vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
At 48 and with 5 children, Antonio Z. C. used to be a street candy vendor for 15 years on the outskirts of a shopping center in Medellín- Colombia. His desire for self-improvement, his desire to get ahead and to offer his family a better future propelled him to obtain a business space in order to expand his selection of products, to have a fixed location, and in so doing, boost sales.

Antonio currently needs a loan in order to purchase more products for his store because his wife recently faced a costly high-risk pregnancy, which deprived him of capital.

The dream of this entrepreneur is to be able to expand his business in the future, offering more and more basic need items and purchasing a farm to grow different crops that he can sell in his store.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María Nelis, reside en San Miguel, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos dependen de ella, María se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que nace por iniciativa propia viéndose en la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos lo necesario ya que aun son pequeños y ella debe dedicarles tiempo y cubrir sus gastos.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería (prendas de vestir), ya que debe periódicamente comprar nuevos estilos y colores en ropa, pues cada día surge una nueva moda por lo cual ella debe estar pendiente y realizar inversiones cada vez que sea necesario.
Su mayor sueño es comprar su propia casa, que espera algún día contar con los fondos necesarios para adquirirla y que sus hijos crezcan en lo propio.
texts.en:
María Nelis is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her parents and three dependent children. She sells clothing for a living, a business that she started on her own initiative after seeing the need to provide for her children--they are still young and she needs to spend time with them and cover their costs. She currently needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise (apparel) because she needs to periodically obtain new styles and colors since every day, new fads are born and she needs to invest as much as necessary.

Her greatest wish is to be able to purchase her own house. She hopes to one day have the funds necessary to purchase one so that her children can grow up adequately.

loans.use: Purchase apparel

loans.name: Sampuli

texts.en:
Sampuli is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school while three are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food vending business for the past eight years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a video café which contributes to her income. Sampuli faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the number of customers is lower leading to low income gained. She hopes to build rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia, D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y su hija, se dedica a vender ropa americana (segunda mano), este negocio es variante y Zonia cuando las ventas van mal instala verduras y aprovecha a ofrecer otro producto al mismo tiempo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar ropa americana, con esta ayuda su negocio estará más surtido, los clientes podrán escoger mejores prendas D. vestir.
Zonia espera con el negocio mejorar su condición económica, ayudar y cubrir las necesidades D. su familia.
texts.en:
Zonia, age 31, lives in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután with her husband and daughter. She sells second-hand American clothing for a living. Her business varies because when sales are down, she offers vegetables at the same time.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase American clothing. With this help, her business will be better stocked, and her customers will have a wider selection of apparel to choose from.

Zonia hopes to improve her financial status with this business, to help out and to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Nueva Esperanza en el distrito de Olmos; una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a mas una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado en su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Ella adicionalmente se dedica  a la confección de vestidos y blusas; las confecciona para luego vendérselas a sus vecinos,

Alicia desea adquirir ganado ovino y caprino para seguir aumentando su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Para Alicia su mayor anhelo sigue siendo sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 25-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and children in the Nueva Esperanza hamlet of the Olmos district, an agricultural area situated in the Lambayeque province, located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells animals, specifically sheep, in a corral at her place of residence. She feeds them natural pasture, and when they have reached the optimal point in their development, she sells them to traders that frequent the area. She also makes dresses and blouses for a living, which she then sells to her neighbors.

Alicia would like to obtain sheep and goats in order to keep expanding her business. For this reason, she feels that it is appropriate to once again request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Alicia's biggest wish is to continue helping her family get ahead and improve their quality of life, which is why she always puts the maximum effort in her work.

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Hanidi

texts.en:
Hanidi is a married woman with six children, four of whom still attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a bread bakery business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Hanidi faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season. She hopes to supply to the entire region in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and baking powder. She decided to work with Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and baking powder

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y su hija, tienen casa propia, el negocio de Elsy tiene 5 años de existir, y este es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta diariamente.
Ella necesita comprar materia prima para realizar la venta como maíz y leña, dichos materiales los necesita tener en abundancia para disponer de ellos todos los días, Elsy solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra y fortalecer las ventas.
Su propósito es velar por el buen funcionamiento del negocio, ya que de él dependen los ingresos del hogar, así también desea en un futuro vender comida al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Elsy lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She is 30 years old and sells tortillas for a living.  She lives with her husband and daughter in their own home.  Elsy has been running this business for 5 years and counts on this daily source of income.  She needs to purchase raw materials such as corn and firewood to keep up with her S..  She needs these materials in abundance in order to prepare her tortillas daily.  

Elsy is requesting a loan to purchase these items to strengthen her S..  Her aim to is to ensure the operation of her business since her family depends on the income.  In the future, she would also like to sell food.

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y su hijo, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva, este negocio nació hace 3 años, las ventas las realiza en las calles y en su casa.
Ella necesita invertir en el negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar pendras de vestir, ya que los clientes le demandan estilos nuevos y ella en ocasiones no los tiene, con esta inversión ella espera mejorar su atención y que sus clientes encuentren en su negocio las prendas que necesitan.
Con el préstamo ella tiene como objetivo: realizar una buena inversión, atender de la mejor manera a los clientes, con su familia espera mejorar su condición y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña María is 48 years old and lives with her husband and son.  They live in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She has been selling new clothing from her house and on the street for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing since her customers want the newest styles and occasionally, she doesn't have them.  She hopes to improve her customer service with this loan so that she can provide her customers with the clothing they need.  With the loan her objectives are to make a good investment and to give her customers the best service.  She also hopes to improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue el motor que impulsó a Gloria S. R. a convertirse en vendedora de productos por catálogo, negocio que inició desde hace 15 años y que le ha permitido aportar en su hogar para ayudarle a su esposo a sostener a sus tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Gloria necesita de un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y además de las ventas por catálogo incluir oferta de productos para el hogar con el fin de captar cada vez más clientes.

En el futuro esta emprendedora espera ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus hijos y brindarles educación superior, para ello, espera seguir trabajando en su negocio, ampliarlo y poder ahorar para su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
The need to pay for household expenses was what motivated Gloria S. R. to start working in catalog sales, a business she started 15 years ago. The income has allowed her to help her husband to support both their home and their three children.

Gloria now needs a loan to expand her business and also to offer household products through catalog sales in order to gain more customers.

In the future this businesswoman hopes to offer a decent life to her children and provide them with a better education. As for herself, she wishes to continue with her business, expand it, and be able to save for her own future and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene  34 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután en este lugar vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, posee un taller de electrónica, Carlos tiene 11 años de dedicarse al taller, sus trabajos mayormente los realiza a domicilio.
Él necesita un préstamo para comprar repuestos para la variedad de artículos que repara teniendo a la mano lo necesario para realizar los trabajos, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar con el taller, ya que tendrá los repuestos necesario para salir con los trabajos en menor tiempo.
Su objetivo es aumentar el servicio a los clientes, mejorando sus equipos electrónicos de forma ágil, obteniendo la preferencia de los clientes. Con su familia espera que al realizar un mejor trabajo sus ingresos sean mejor y pueda ofrecerles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
34-year old Carlos lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután, with his wife and two children aged 10 and 14. He has run an electronics workshop for eleven years; most of his work is done from his home. 

Carlos needs a loan so he can have on hand the spares for the wide variety of items that he repairs. This would enable him to improve the workshop since he would have the necessary spares to complete the work in the least amount of time.

His goal is to offer even better service to his customers by having good electronic equipment so that they will choose to come to him. He also hopes that with a greater income he will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Elida Elvecia

texts.es:
Elida de 25 años de edad., reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería, el negocio lo inicio hace un año y medio, tiene una hermana que le ayuda en algunos momentos a vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, cosméticos y perfumes, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener a disposición de los clientes buena cantidad de mercadería, teniendo mejores oportunidades de venta.
Su objetivo es que a través del trabajo que realiza un día poder tener su propio local, amplio donde pueda atender a la clientela y desarrollarse como una comerciante.
texts.en:
Elida, 25, lives with her husband in Jiquilisco, Usulután department and she sells cosmetics and perfume.  She started the business a year and a half ago with a sister who occasionally helps her sell.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, cosmetics and perfumes.  This will help her keep  a good quantity of merchandise for her customers so that she has more opportunity to sell.
Through this work her aim is to some day have her own business location large enough that she can take care of her customers, and that she can develop into a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Gianina Milagros

texts.es:
Gianina, tiene 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la Zona de Raúl Porras, distrito de Carabayllo. 
Es Licenciada en Educación(Profesora de Educación Inicial); la cual trabaja para mantener a sus hijos y salir adelante, tambien vende prodructos de belleza a sus vecinos y colegas. 
Gianina actualmente estudia en la Universidad de la Cantuta para obtener su Maestría.
Sus meta es poder terminar su carrera.
Gianina desea seguir capacitándose, tener éxito como profesional y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar para que sean profesionales. 
Con el préstamo solicitado desea pagar sus estudios para poder terminar su Maestría.
texts.en:
Gianina, 36, is single and has 2 children.  She lives in the Raul Porras area of the Carabayllo district. 

She has a degree in education, and she works as an elementary school teacher to support her children.  To get ahead she also sells beauty products to her neighbors and co-workers. 

Gianina is currently studying at the University of Cantuta to get her Master's degree.  Her goal is to be able to finish this degree. 

Gianina wants further training so that she can have professional success, and so that her children can finish their education and become professionals.

With the loan she requests, she plans to pay for her studies so that she can complete her Master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for studies toward a Master's degree

loans.name: Ana Maria Carlas

texts.es:
Doña Ana, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel,  vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa y tiene 41 años de edad, su forma de verde es ambulante, doña Ana en compañía de su esposo realizan las ventas diariamente.
Ella por el momento necesita un préstamo para compra ropa y Joyas de oro, estos pues para ofrecer a los clientes, ayudando así al negocio y sus ingresos, ya que al tener mercadería que ofrecer tiene la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas. 
El sueño de doña Ana con respecto al negocio, es tener su propio vehículo donde salir a ofrecer y distribuir ropa por los alrededores, con su familia quiere estabilizar su condición económica y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana lives in San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two children who are 15 and 18 years old. She peddles wares and is 41 years old. Mrs. Ana sells daily with her husband.

At the moment she needs a loan to buy clothes and golden jewelry so she can offer more to her patients. This will help her make more profits since having more merchandise will increase her possibilities of selling more.

Mrs. Ana's dream is to have her own vehicle to go out to offer and distribute clothes around town. She wants to help her family financially and help her children with their education.

loans.use: To buy clothes and golden jewelry.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos, en su casa propia y lo que más desean es salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 8 años, es la repostería de bocaditos y tortas, que los preparaba para los cumpleaños de sus familiares y eventos que se realiza en el colegio que estudian sus hijos,  y desde entonces fue haciéndose conocida en su barrio. En la actualidad la mayoría de sus vecinos requieren de sus servicios, es por ello que su trabajo se esta siendo cada vez más rentable. En vista de ello su hija Escarlet de 15 años le sugiere “colgar las fotografías de la variedad de su repostería en la Web”, pero ella primero piensa implementarse con accesorios primordiales e indispensables  que le permitan realizar acabados impecables a sus decoraciones, ya que solo así dice” ganarse buena imagen y después en adelante instalar su local  en su casa propia”. Es su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, demostrando compromiso y comprensión con los integrantes de su asociación. Jenny, con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos y accesorios de repostería, de ese modo asegura que mejorará su trabajo y aumentará sus ganancias.
texts.en: Jenny is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 42 years old lives with her husband and three children. They live in their own home and what they want is to improve their standard of living. For more than 8 years she has been working at a bakery to sell snacks and sandwiches she prepares for family member's birthdays and other events held in her children's school. Since then she became known more and more around her neighborhood. At the moment the majority of her neighbors require her services so her business is becoming more profitable. Based on this, her 15 year old daughter Escarlet suggests she "posts photographs of the variety of meals she make on the internet," however Jenny has in mind to first stock up on essential materials that will make excellent decorations. That way she can "develop a decent image and in the future install the bakery in her home." This is the eighth loan she has requested from MFP and has demonstrated commitment and understanding with the members of the association. With the loan she is requesting, Jenny plans on buying materials and bakery accessories to improve her business and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients to make cakes and snacks.

loans.name: Vidal De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Vidal, tiene 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, ella trabaja con la ayuda D. sus hijas Gloribel D. 23 años y María Luisa D. 28 años D. edad, este negocio nació hace mucho y tiempo, hacen las tortillas en su casa por las mañanas y al mismo tiempo las comercializan, su inconveniente es que rápidamente se les agotan el maíz y la leña.
Doña Vidal está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en leña, maíz, gas, ya que con esta inversión quiere tener una gran cantidad D. materiales para disponer D. ella, lo bueno en esta inversión es que son materiales que no se dañan y que se pueden almacenar por vario tiempo.
Con el préstamo espera mejorar el negocio, e ir avanzando para lograr algún día un local donD. puedan sus hijas ofrecer las tortillas, para mantener sus propios hogares.
texts.en:
Ms. Vidal is 40 years old and lives in the Guatajiagua department of Morazán. She sells tortillas and works with the help of her daughters Gloribel, 23, and Maria Luisa, 28 years old. This business was born many years ago. They make the tortillas at home in the morning and market them at the same time. Their problem is that they quickly run out of corn and firewood. 
Ms. Vidal is requesting a loan to invest in firewood, corn, and gas since with this investment she would like to have a large quantity of materials at her disposal. The good thing about this investment is that they are materials that don't spoil and can be stored for a long time.
With this loan she hopes to improve her business and continue advancing to one day obtain the premises where daughters can offer tortillas and be able to support their own homes.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel K. est agent de Compassion International, une organisation Rwandais qui aide les enfants, commerçant des accessoires téléphoniques, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 37 ans, il est marié, et né a Congo (RDC).  Il a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 11 ans, 3 de qui vont à l’école, et il a fini 5 ans d’école secondaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de 60 téléphones, 1 ordinateur, 1 amplificateur, 1 radio, 100 batteries, 200 chargeurs, et 300 housings pour son commerce des accessoires téléphoniques à Gisenyi.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solliciter ce crédit tout en augmentant les quantités vendues dans son atelier, il achètera aussi les matériels de technicité.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer lui-même, développer son secteur, et construire sa propre maison commerciale.  Pour la vie, il voudrait assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.  Pour gagner plus de revenue, il loue une maison pour 60,000FRW par mois.
texts.en: Daniel K. is an agent of Compassion International, a Rwandan organization helping children, a vendor of phone accessories and a client of ACD since 2009. He is 37 years old and married. He is born in Congo (RDC). He has four children between two and 11 years of age, three of whom are in school. He has finished five years of secondary school. He is going to use his loan to purchase 60 phones, one computer, one amplifier, one radio, 100 batteries, 200 chargers and 300 cases for his phone accessories store in Gisenyi. His business strategy is to take out loans allowing him to increase his sales volume. He also buys electronic parts. He would like to be able to become financially independent, grow his business and open his own company. As to his private life, he would like to ensure the well-being of his family and provide for his children’s school fees. In order to increase his revenue, he rents out a house for 60,000 Rwandan francs per month.

loans.use: Purchasing 60 phones, a computer, batteries for mobile phones, etc,
