La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the "SEÑOR PASION” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Luz Marina is 34 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She is also an elementary school teacher and teaches at the 'Colegio Nacional de Urubamba'.  She is a very happy and optimistic person and, through her work, she gets her family ahead in life.

Luz Marina is requesting a loan to buy feed, such as fodder, corn, etc., for her animals.  She will also buy more animals.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy feed, such as fodder, corn, etc., for her animals and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old and is  married with three children aged between 7 and 16 years old.  Jacqueline sells various foodstuffs in her business such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  Jacqueline has had her business for 16 years and employs five people.  Her business is open from 5am until 10pm every day. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance company in order to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on.  With any profit, she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. is married and has two children. She is a seamstress. She also sells soaps and other cleaning agents at Abura, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a carpenter. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase varieties of soaps to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase varieties of soaps for resale

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celinda; ella tiene 40 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de transporte ella tiene un  bus interprovincial el cual la socia lo administra, el bus sale todos los días en la ruta del Valle Sagrado tiene su chofer el cual maneja el bus y muy de vez en cuando su esposo también maneja, la socia a la vez es docente del nivel primario en el colegio nacional de Urubamba siendo estas dos las únicas actividades que realiza por el momento  para así poder sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento del carro y comprar algunos accesorios que le hacen falta.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celinda is a member of the “SEÑOR PASION” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Celinda is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her transport business.  Celinda owns a bus which travels between provinces.  She is in charge of managing the bus which runs every day on the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) route.  She has a driver who drives the bus and her husband drives it too though not very often.  Celinda is also an elementary school teacher at 'Colegio Nacional de Urubamba'.  These are the only work activities she carries out right now in order to get her family ahead in life.

Celinda is requesting her loan so that she can have maintenance work done on her vehicle and so that she can buy some accessories that she lacks.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance work on her vehicle and to buy some accessories that she lacks

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: For the past four years, Ekua K. has been selling raw rice and sugar in various quantities in Abura, Cape Coast.  A mother of three children, she is married to a driver whom she assists in taking care of the home. Ekua will use her loan to buy extra bags of rice and sugar for sale, and hopes to use any additional business profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Marisa Jesús

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisa; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia es docente del nivel inicial en un jardín en el distrito de Yucay ella lleva años trabajando en este lugar, le gusta mucho su carrera ya que tiene que estar con niños aunque a veces le hacen perder la paciencia pero al final los trata siempre con mucho cariño esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y desea poder seguir adelante ya que este es el único medio que tiene ella para sacar a su familia adelante y mediante su trabajo y los ahorros con su esposo pudo construir su casita pero aun le falta terminar.

La socia solicita el préstamo para terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa ya que mediante su sueldo de profesora no le permite construir. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marisa belongs to the “Señor Pasión” Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Marisa is a teacher at the kindergarten level in the district of Yucay. She has worked for years there. She enjoys her career very much because she likes to be with children, although at times she loses her patience. But she always treats the children with much love. At present, this is Marisa's only economic activity and her only means of advancing her family. By means of her work and her and her husband's savings, they have managed to construct their little house, but it isn't finished yet.

Marisa is requesting a loan to finish construction on the second floor of their home, since her salary as a teacher won't cover construction. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: TO FINISH CONSTRUCTING THE SECOND FLOOR OF HER HOUSE, SINCE HER TEACHER'S SALARY WON'T COVER IT.

loans.name: Unidas Para Siempre Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Unidas Para Siempre, porque es un grupo que se ha consolidado perfectamente ya que tienen mucho tiempo de conocerse. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 12 integrantes. La señora Veronica P. N., tiene 36 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos, 1 mujer y 2 varones. Ella se dedica principalmente a la venta de cosmeticos, así como a la venta de lenceria, además de las ventas de temporada, negocio que inicio aproximadamente hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para tener una mayor inversion en mercancia y como consecuencia hacer crecer su negocio, el cual le genere mayores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia, ya que estan apunto de asenderla como animadora por sus altos indices de venta. Es importante resaltar que tiene un gran número de clientes en diversas comunidades, los cuales se sinten a gusto con el servicio que les brinda al momento de ofrecerles un producto. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente contenta, porque quiere el crédito para empezar a concluir planes que no se han podido consolidar por mucho tiempo por falta de capital. También espera gozar de todos los beneficios que el crédito le pueda brindar posteriormente.
texts.en:
This group is called "Unidas Para Siempre" [United Forever], because the group is made up of people who have known each other for a long time.  They are located in Hidalgo, Mexico.  The group has 12 members.

Veronica P. N is 36 years old, studied until high school, works as a merchant, and has three children (one daughter and two sons).  Her main business is selling cosmetics, but she also sells lingerie and other seasonal items.  She started her business about two years ago.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise so that she can grow her business and earn more income and provide a better quality of life for herself and her family, who are very proud of her high levels of sales.  It is important to note that she has a large number of customers from different communities, who are happy with the service she provides them.  She is happy to be asking for this loan because she wants the loan to begin to finish plans that she hasn't been able to move forward with because she lacked the money.  She also hopes to enjoy the benefits that the loan will offer later.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Ms. Felicia is an old customer of our institution, who has been in the sewing business for 10 years and has established customers. Her main customers are public institutions, such as schools, for whom she makes uniforms. She will use this loan to buy fabric to meet an order from a company. To date Ms. Felicia has been given 15 loans. She says that this loan will improve her business providing her with a better standard of living. She owns her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, and sewing needles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING BEAUTY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Suzzy

texts.en: Suzzy E. is a widow who takes care of 7 dependants. She has completed her senior year of high school education. Suzzy sells "wakye" (rice and beans cooked together) at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. This dish is normally served with spaghetti, hot pepper and tomato sauce. Suzzy uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She is asking for the loan to purchase more rice, beans, and other food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Suzzy plans to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans and other food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Yaka

texts.fr:
Yaka D. est une femme veuve. Elle vit avec ses 10 enfants et a aussi la charge d'un petit fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA depuis son inauguration le 03 mai 1997. Elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion dudit Banc Villageois. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de niébé, d'arachide et de lait caillé. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. 

Son crédit lui permet de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Par exemple à payer la nourriture, à payer les soins médicaux, à payer les fournitures scolaires etc.
texts.en:
Yaka D. is a widow. She lives with her ten children, and also has a grandson in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SANGHE DOUKA since its inauguration on May 3, 1997. She is also a member of its management committee. 

She has been selling niebe, groundnuts, and milk curd for over ten years.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business by increasing her stocks. With the profits, she will provide for her family with food, medical care, school supplies, etc.

loans.use: Buying groundnuts, niebe and milk curd for resale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. sells plantains and tomatoes at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has a junior high school education and is married with five children. Her husband is a policeman. Abena has been selling plantains for 10 years, assisting her husband in supporting their home. Her loan will be added to her capital to purchase more plantains to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to meet customer need.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua O. cooks "jollof rice" (rice cooked in a tomato-based sauce) for sale at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. The tomato sauce gives the rice a different colour and flavour. Ekua lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for ten years. She assists her husband feed, educate and cloth the children. The loan will be used to buy additional bags of rice and other food items to prepare food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in expanding her selection of dishes. (In the picture, the pot of reddish sauce is the tomato sauce that is served with the jollof rice.)

loans.use: To buy rice and other food items to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu A. is single and sells clothes, cosmetics, and other items s at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast.  Salamatu has received a junior high school education. She started this business recently and it is her livelihood. Her loan will be use to expand her business and she hopes to build another shop with the increased income.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio G., de 41 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco,  convive con Nancy Berrocal de 26 años y  fruto de ese gran amor tienen 02 hijos;  Annie de 04 años y Rebeca de 01 año de edad,  juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Santa Rosa  departamento de Ayacucho. Aurelio, es un hombre trabajador que lucha por la prosperidad de su familia. Su Trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno, en donde cultiva, hojas de coca, cacao y café. Ha trabajando durante 13 años y según afirma que le aún le gusta esta actividad, además que lo hace de manera independiente y durante el tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros que contrata para extraer el cacao y las hojas de coca, productos comprados por las empresas acopiadoras, dándole muy buen rentabilidad. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero, para comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar nuevas plantas como plátano y piña. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los dos  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y  fertilizantes para mejorar su parcela y así obtener mejores cosechas mas adelante.
texts.en: Aurelio G., 41, is a native of the Anco district.  He lives with Nancy Berrocal, 26, and from this relationship has 2 children: Annie, 4, and Rebeca,1. They all live together in their own home in the community of Santa Rosa in the department of Ayacucho.  Aurelio is a hardworking man who strives to provide his family with prosperity.  He is a farmer who has 4 hectares of land where he cultivates coca leaves, cocoa and coffee.  He has worked for 13 years, and states that he still enjoys this work, since he can work independently.  During the harvest season he hires workers to help him harvest the cocoa and coca leaves, products that are purchased by the wholesale companies that give him good profits.  What he considers to be most difficult is to move the products from the harvest to the drying area.  In the future, he hopes to gather together more money to buy new lands and to cultivate new crops such as bananas and pineapples.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels that this support will help him a lot to make progress with his business.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will buy cocoa seeds and fertilizers to improve his land and in this way obtain better harvests in the future.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana E. is a single mother taking care of four children. She has been through junior high school. Nana moves around in her locality to sell ice cream at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She uses her income to maintain her home. She is requesting to use the loan to buy larger quantities of ice cream to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to add the sale of food items to her business.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.en:
"El Rincon de las Amigas" group was created by the formation of the Family Committee of the district of San Salvador, which was at its second meeting and the number of participants exceeded the allowable amount. Therefore, split in two.
Today, the committee comprises 12 members and is in the tenth cycle of the program.
Ms. Maria Rossana L., for example, makes the sale of food. She invested the money in the purchase of goods to produce the food they sell, they want to give his family a better quality of life, it is hard living in poverty.

loans.use: Buying goods to make food to sell.

loans.name: Mi Progreso Group

texts.es:
Lidia, es soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Zona de Villa Esperanza, distrito de Carabayllo. Es presidenta del grupo “Mi Progreso”.
Hace dos años trabaja como cocinera, empezó en un Proyecto Estudiantil, en la iglesia Bautista Valle del Jordán, lugar donde asiste ella, cocinaba con un grupo de hermanas para los niños, luego el Pastor decidió alquilar un local por Canta, desde entonces Lidia trabaja ahí, ella es la encargada del local.
Gracias a ese negocio tiene estabilidad económica, ayuda a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. 
Su meta más importante es tener su propio restaurante, eso le permita tener más ingresos e invertirlo en lo más importante para ella y sus padres.
Con el préstamo solicitado desea invertir para comprar mercadería para el local de comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, 42, is single and lives in the Villa Esperanza area of the Carabayollo district.  She is the president of the group "Mi Progreso."  

For two years she has worked as a cook; she started in a Student Project in the Bautista Valle del Jordán church, where she attended services.  She used to cook with a group of sisters for the children.  Later the Pastor decided to rent a place in Canta, and ever since Lidia has worked there.  She is in charge of the place.  Thanks to this business she has economic stability, and she is able to help her parents with the household expenses.  

Her most important goal is to have her own restaurant.  This would allow her to have more income and invest in what is most important for her and her parents.  With the loan requested she wants to purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: María Tenais

texts.es:
María es madre de familia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el  Centro Poblado menor  Insculas ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el mercado de ese centro poblado del distrito de Olmos desde hace dos años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Con los ingresos que percibe esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea  adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio teniendo en cuenta la creciente demanda por la lejanía que existe al distrito de Olmos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a 43 year-old mother.  She is married and lives with her husband and their 3 children in the village of Insculas, located in the Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with a substantial amount of commercial activity that is located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria has had a small store located in a market in this small town in the Olmos district for 2 years.  Here she offers her customers a diverse set of consumer goods, including basic necessities and groceries.  The store is well received by the public because of the quality of the products offered and the good service provided.  With the income that she earns from this activity she is able to help support her family.

Maria wants to acquire more products to expand her store, taking into account the growing demand that exists in her relatively remote area.  For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles.  With this investment, she thinks she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to acquire more products to expand her business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Ms. Eufemia is 55 years old, she is currently married and has a 33 year old daughter that has her respective family. Ms. Eufemia has a grocery store in her house for over 11 years (Ña Reina), where she sells top necessity products and drinks (there is a soccer court in which tournaments are held on the weekends.)

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying sugar, rice, flour and herbs in larger quantities to get a better buying price and higher profit in sales.

loans.use: Wholesale buying of sugar, rice, noodles and flour.

loans.name: Irean

texts.en:
Irean W. is married and has 2 children. She has been through junior high school. Irean is a teacher and she also sells provisions at Abbrem Agona near Abura, which she has been doing for 8 years. Her husband is a pastor. Irean uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the children.  Irean will use the loan to purchase more provisions to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Irean plans to build a shop. 
In this picture, Irean is holding in her hand some toffees and biscuits.

loans.use: Irean will use the loan to purchase more provisions to expand her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. sells fried fish and banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough) at Abbrem Agona near Aburam, Cape Coast. Abena has received junior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Abena has been selling fried fish and banku for 7 years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of corn and other ingredients to cook banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy bags of corn and other ingredients to cook banku for sale.

loans.name: Compartiendo El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Compartiendo el Triunfo, porque como lo dice la frase es señal de que a todos les va a comenzar a ir mejor economicamente y es una forma de compartir el triunfo entre todas. Estan ubicadas en Tetepango H. en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Donaciana Leticia S. integrante del grupo, tiene 52 años, es comerciante y tiene 1 hijo varon. Ella se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa, novedades y regalos, negocio que inicio aproximadamente hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para tener una mayor inversion en mercancia y como consecuencia hacer crecer su negocio, el cual le genere mayores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es importante resaltar que tiene un gran número de clientes en la comunidad, los cuales se sinten a gusto con el servicio que brinda. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente contenta, porque quiere el crédito para ampliar su local y comenzar a expandirse en los pueblos cercanos, comenzando a realizar proyectos que no había podido consolidar por falta de capital.
texts.en: This group is named Compartiendo el Triunfo (Sharing the Triumph) because the phrase is a sign that everyone is going to starting to improve economically and it is a way to share that victory. The group is located in Tetepango H. in México. Compartiendo el Triunfo has ten members. Donaciana Leticia S. is a member of the group. She is 52 years old and a merchant. She has one son. Donaciana primarily sells clothing, novelties and gifts. She started this business about two years ago. She is requesting the loan to invest in a larger amount of merchandise. As a result, she can grow her business and generate greater profits and a better quality of life for her family. It is important to point out that she has a large number of customers in the community and they are comfortable with the service she offers.  Donaciana is pleased with requesting the loan because she wants the loan in order to expand her business to other nearby towns. She can start projects that she could not start before due to a lack of capital.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. sells doughnuts’ at Abbrem Agona near Abura. Ekua has received a junior high education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling doughnuts for 2 years. Her income helps to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy additional flour and other ingredients to produce larger quantities of doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a snack bar.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional flour and other ingredients to produce larger quantities of doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to fry more doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua N. is married and currently taking care of four children.  Efua cooks food like banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough) and rice to sell at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for three years. Her husband is a farmer.  Efua uses the income she generates from her sales to help feed and educate their children. Efua will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to store to increase her sales as the price of goods is steadily increasing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah K. moves from one area to another to sell jewelry at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She is divorced and has two children. Theresah has been selling jewelry for two years. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to acquire other varieties of jewelry for resale. She anticipates using the new profit to establish a jewelry shop.

loans.use: To acquire other varieties of jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua L. is divorced and has three children. Efua fries doughnuts for sale and serves them with porridge at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for five years now. Efua uses her income to see to the general welfare of her home.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more bags of flour and other ingredients to fry for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her increased sales back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama CAMINO AL ÉXITO. Esta ubicado en Temascalcingo, Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. L. señora María D. los Angeles R. es una D. las integrante D. este grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió L. primaria, es casada y aún mantiene 3 hijos, 2 niños y una niña. ElL. tiene viviendo en L. comunidad 11 años y se dedica a L. venta D. dulces y bordado D. servilletas, estas actividades las inicio hace 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para comprar telas e hilos para surtir su negocio. Sus clientes comentan que sus costuras son mejores en cuanto al diseño y creatividad, se sienten contentos y satisfechos D. poder contar con el tipo D. trabajo que ofrece L. señora. Al solicitar este prestamo elL. se siente agradecida y comprometida a seguir solicitando crédito para poder cumplir con sus metas y consolidar su negocio. María desea elaborar servilletas a gran escaL. para tener un ingreso más amplio que le permita brindarle a sus hijos una educacion D. calidad  y brindarles una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This group is called "Camino al Exito" [Path to Success].  It is located in Temascalcingo, Mexico.  There are 11 members of the group.

María D. los Angeles R. is one of the members of the group.  She is 47 years old, went to primary school, is married, and has three children (two sons and a daughter).  She has lived in the community for 11 years and has worked selling sweets and embroidered napkins for one year.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase fabric and thread to supply her business.  Her customers say that her sewing is the best in terms of design and creativity and they are happy and satisfied to be able to count on the type of work that she offers.  She is grateful to be asking for this loan and she is committed to continuing to ask for loans to be able to meet her goals and build her business.  María wants to make napkins on a larger scale to earn more income in order to proviD. her children with a quality education so that they can have professional careers.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells provisions, food items, and soap at Abbrem Agona near Abra, Cape Coast. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling food items for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of food items for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana B. is a widow taking care of five dependants. Nana sells clothes and body creams at Abbrem Agona near Abura, which she has been doing for two years. She sells her wares from one area to another. Nana uses her income to feed, educate and clothe her dependants. Nana will use the loan to purchase varieties of hair and body creams to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase varieties of hair and body creams to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. sells smoked fish at Abbrem Agona near Abura in Cape Coast. Adjoa received a junior high education. She is divorced and has three children. Adjoa has been selling fish for three years and is responsible for the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build proper shade where she can sell.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. is a seamstress at Abbrem Agona near Abura. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married and has one child. Maame has been a seamstress for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy materials and other sewing equipment to enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy materials and other sewing equipment to enable her to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells kenkey (a staple in Ghana made of fermented maize and usually dipped in a spicy tomato-based sauce) and doughnuts at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She is divorced and has three children. Aba has been selling kenkey and doughnuts for 30 years. She sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two computers with their corresponding desks.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba N. is married and has two children. She has received a senior high education. For the past eight years, Araba has been selling fried fish at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver. Araba uses her income to pay for their children’s school fees and their family’s utility bills.  Araba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Jorge  Isaac

texts.es:
Jorge Isaac M. C. de 34 años de edad nacido en la comunidad El Rosario, Esteli de oficio agicultor, es casado , tiene 2 hijos el es la principal fuente de ingreso. Comenzo su negocio a  la edad de 15 años con la  siembra tradicional;empezo con media manzana de tomate , luego aumento a una manzana de tomate con ayuda de su familia.Siempre se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos basicos y tabaco pues tiene mas de 15 años de conocer este oficio  .Hoy en dia posee unas cuantas vacas para el consumo de leche y los bueyes,fruto de su labor en la siembra de granos basicos.Don Jorge solicito el prestamo para poder comprar un motor de riego y asi poder seguir produciendo hortalizas.Ya que con esto el espera mejores rendimientos en su cosecha.
Su meta es seguir adelante con los cultivos para poder producir mas y mejores hortalizas venderlo a un buen precio que le genere mejores ganacias y sacar adelante a sus hijos dandoles una buena educacion y un futuro mejor que el  que tuvo el.
texts.en:
Jorge Isaac M. C., age 34, was born in the El Rosario community in Esteli.  He is a farmer.  He is married and has two children.  He is the primary source of income.  When he was 15 he started his business with traditional plants.  He started with half of a block (equal to approximately 1.7 acres) of tomatoes.  Then, with help from his family, he increased it to a block of tomatoes.   He has always devoted himself to growing basic grains and tobacco.  He has over 15 years of experience in this line of work.

He now has some cows that give them milk to drink, and he has oxen.  These animals are the fruit of his work growing basic grains.

Jorge requested the loan to be able to buy a motor for irrigation.  That way he will continue producing vegetables.  With this he hopes to have a better yield at harvest time.

His goal is to get ahead with the crops in order to be able to produce more, improved vegetables.  He will sell them at a good price and generate income.  He will get his children ahead with a good education and a better future than he had.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation motor and to continue producting vegetables

loans.name: Las Reinas Group

texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to the support and unity of several women who are neighbors from Villa Elisa. One of the members, Ms. Laura Patricia Rodriguez, came to the foundation to learn more about our programs. Currently, this group is in "strengthening" process, where every member carries out their own business. They also have a member with a sick child, and they are all helping her. 

Mrs. Melanie L., for example, sells clothing by going from house to house. She does this in order to obtain a higher income and better standard of living for her family.

Group members are all working together. Although they still need help in management, they are eager to continue with their different business activities. They appreciate very much the help given to them by the foundation and the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" committee.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and underwear

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi T. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school. Naomi has been selling provisions, cooking utensils and earthenware pots at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast, for 10 years. Her husband is a teacher. Her income helps pay for their children’s school fees and utility bills. Naomi will use the loan to purchase additional utensils and earthenware pots to sell. She plans to build another shop at a different locality.

loans.use: To purchase additional utensils and earthenware pots to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has seven dependants. Ama cooks banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough, usually served with fried fish) at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a storekeeper. Ama uses her income to pay for their children’s school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase extra bags of maize and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale. Her business objective is to reinvest her additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase extra bags of maize and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua P. is married and has seven dependants. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough) and serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been cooking for sale for 13 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to provide food for their family. Ekua will invest the loan into the banku business. Her business goal is to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: To invest in the banku business.

loans.name: Los Angeles Caidos Group

texts.es: En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado LOS ANGELES CAIDOS, el cual esta ubicado en el estado D. Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 miembros. La Señora Flora R. V. es una D. las integrantes D. 69 años y estudió hasta cuarto grado D. primaria, es casada, en total tiene 6 hijos, 3 hombres y 3 mujeres. Es dueña D. una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella comenta que aunque es chica ha procurado mantenerla bien surtida para que sus clientes no se vayan, tiene varios años ya con este negocio, está contenta ya que sus clientes le responden con su preferencia, la señora Flora es muy amable y da buenos precios. También se dedica a vender comida a obreros que trabajan en la maquiladora que esta cerca D. su casa, dice que este negocio le ha dado buenos rendimientos. Hoy esta contenta y satisfecha agradece el buen servicio y los créditos otorgados pues le estan ayudando a incrementar su negocio, comenta que este prestamo lo destinara a la compra D. más mercancia y para surtir su tienda, y con las ganacias comprar platos y basos para sus comensales. Por otra parte tiene el firme propósito D. poder arreglar alguna D. sus cuartos D. su casa pues actualmente estan todos techados con lamina D. asbesto. Ella esta segura que con la ayuda del prestamo en un futuro lograra su meta.
texts.en: This picture shows the group called "Los Angeles Caidos," located in the state of Puebla, Mexico.  This group is comprised of 9 members.  Mrs. Flora R. V. is one of the members, she 69 years old and studied through the fourth graD..  She is married and has six children: 3 men and 3 woman.  She is the owner of a small grocery store and says that even though it's small she has been able to keep it well stocked so her customers don't go elsewhere.  She has had this business for several years and is happy that her customers prefer it.  Mrs. Flora is very nice and gives good prices.  She also sells food to workers who work in the maquiladora (factory) near her home.  She says this business has provided good returns.  Today, she is happy, satisfied, and grateful for the good service and loans authorized because they are helping her increase her business.  She says this loan is destined for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store. She will buy plates and bases for her guests with the earnings.  On the other hand, she plans to help fix up some of her rooms in her house since they are already doing roofs with laminated asbestos.  She is sure that with the help of the loan, she will achieve her goal in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa N. operates a food joint at Abbrem Agona near Abura Cape Coast. She cooks varieties of food such as fufu (a thick paste made by pounding boiled cassava and plantain, as shown in the picture), banku (another staple made from a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough), boiled yam and others. Adjoa is a widow and has six dependants. She is responsible for the general upkeep of her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy additional food items to cook to bring variety into her business. She plans to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to cook to bring variety into her business.

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.en:
This committee is on probation because during the last loan, the payments were delayed several days.  All the members are from Villa Elisa. They had inconveniences for the punctual payment. The committee was formed thanks to Ms. Edith D. A. and they committed to keep their payments punctual. The members who didn't pay on time were expelled from the committee. 

Mrs. Flora A., for example, is a seller of clothes and has a customer or client base well-formed, all the time and was working in the field. She longs to progress economically and have her own clothing store. 

Nevertheless, they all keep going forward with their projects and they are all very grateful for the support and opportunity given to them.

loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the support of several woman neighbors of Villa Elisa. Ms. Matilde M. was an intermediary who came to the foundation to learn about our programs.
Today, this group is in excellent condition. Its members are responsible and keep their payments punctual to avoid troubles with the foundation. They all have their own business.  They work jointly and together and they look forward to continue doing so.

Mrs. Matilde is a seamstress. She makes costumes and uniforms. Now that we approach the start of classes in schools across the country, she is requesting a loan to buy all the materials needed to make them. 

All of the members are people who wish to succeed in all aspects (life, family and business).  They appreciate very much the help given to them by the foundation and thank the opportunity offered by the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" committee.

loans.use: Clothing sales, clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Activas De Chapulco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ACTIVAS DE CHAPULCO, el cual esta ubicado en la comunidad de CHAPULCO en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. En la fotografia se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la señora Teodora S. M., Ella tiene 55 años y estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y tiene  un hijo. La señora vende cosméticos por catálogos aproximadamente más de 3 años, sus clientes la prefieren porque les da precio razonable y en pequeños pagos, comentan que aparte de su amabilidad ha procurado entregar sus productos lo más rápido posible. La señora Teodora comenta que este crédito lo destinara a la compra de más mercancia y para surtit los pedido pendientes. Las ganacias las esta destinando para cubrir sus pago de mercancía. También desea construir una pequeña barda en un terreno que tiene en su localidad. Esta segura que con la ayuda de la institucion y con la entrega de mas creditos a futuro lograra sus meta.
texts.en:
This group is called "Activas de Chapulco" and is located in the community of Chapulco in the state of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has 10 members.  

The photograph shows Teodora S.M.'s business.  She is 55 years old, studied until fifth grade, and has a son.  She has sold cosmetics by catalog for more than three years.  Her customers prefer her because she offers reasonable prices and small payments.  In addition to her kindness, she also delivers her products as quickly as possible.  

This loan will allow Teodora to purchase more merchandise and fill all of her outstanding orders.  The profits will cover her payments for more merchandise.  She would also like to build a small fence on a plot of land she has.  She is certain that with the help of the institution and with future loans, she will be able to meet her goal.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Rosmari

texts.en:
Ms. Rosmari is a 37 year old tradeswoman, single mom, with a 12 year old son currently in primary school.  They live in the child's grandmother's house in Villa Elisa because the grandmother is an old lady who need to be taken care of.  According to Rosmari she has been through a rough path in her life.  She had to begin working when she was twelve.  Her mother was also a tradeswoman, and she owned different sales stores in the market (Mercado 4).  Rosmari was a hawker selling all kinds of items (matches, paper, etc.). 

Later in her life she began working as a salin salesperson, which allowed her to continue with her studies, although she never made it pass the 2nd grade.  Saving and getting small loans she began to raise an investment capital, and she was able to get her own small store in the market, which she used to sell baby clothing. 

She then had her son and she decided to open a small restaurant close to her house, so she can look after her baby. 

Today, her small restaurant has pretty good clientele and she could also open a new store in the market where she sells woman clothing and underwear.  She says that the credit given to support her two businesses help to generate income to her house, which could provide better opportunities to her son in his life.

loans.use: buying of meat, wines, soft drinks and different bakery supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth de 33 años de edad, labora como conserje para el CETA INATEC  desde hace 9 años,  es una mujer trabajadora, servicial pero sobre todo bien humilde es bien querida por sus vecinos y compañeros de   trabajo, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos.                                                              

Solicita su decimo credito  para comprar materiales de construccion y construir una habitacion y asi gozar de mejores condiciones en el hogar, agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado en el credito anterior ya que fue posible repellar la pared de la habitacion que tiene actualmente.                                                                                                       
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su linda familia permanezca unida y bien con Dios, que no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar .
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 33, has been employed as a Caretaker for CETA INATEC for nine years.  She’s a hard working, helpful but above all, quite humble, woman who is very well liked by her neighbors and coworkers.  Her life partner works as a Bricklayer and together they share family expenses and acquired obligations.

She is asking for her 10th loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a bedroom to have better living conditions in her home.  She is grateful to Kiva for the support provided in the previous loan since it made it possible for her to seal the wall in the bedroom she currently has.

Her greatest dream in life is that her lovely family stays together and on good terms with God; that their home lacks none of the basics.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna tiene 62 años, su actividad económica es la venta de madera. Hace más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos Ella se siente muy motivada por continuar trabajando pues es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mantener activo su negocio por lo que esto hace que Reyna se sienta muy orgullosa. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de madera y herramientas. Siempre sueña con ampliar su pequeño taller y proporcionarle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Reyna, 62, sells lumber.  She’s been in this business for over 25 years so this isn’t her first loan request.  

She is very motivated to keep working because through the loans she has been able to keep her business going and this makes Reyna feel very proud.

The loan will be used for working capital to buy wood and tools.  She always dreams with expanding her little workshop and provide her family with more comfort.

loans.use: To buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Dinorak Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Dinorak de 40 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la colonia los angeles desde hace 3 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria impartinado el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comarca , su mamà la apoya con el cuido de sus hijos,  su esposo se dedica  a comercializar ganado, ambos se ayudan con los gastos familiares,                                                                                                   Solicita su 3er credito para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda, asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones en el hogar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida e ir mejorando poco a poco su condiciones de vida para su mayor comodidad en el Hogar.
texts.en:
Dinorak is 40 years old and works as a teacher in the los angeles neighborhood, she has taught elementary school for three years to the rural kids of that area, her mom supports her by taking care of her children, her husband sells cattle and they help each other with the family expenses.  She requests her third credit to fix the kitchen in her home and provide her family with better living conditions. 

Her biggest dream in life is to keep her family united and improve little by little their life conditions for more comfort in their home.

loans.use: Fix kitchen

loans.name: Sonia Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia has 29 years of age, is a single mother with a child. Sonia is dedicated to the making of garments of different varieties and has extensive experience in handling such work.  For a long time, she worked as a clerk in a clothing factory until two years ago she decided to start her own sewing workshop, for which she established a partnership with a friend, because she did not have all the machines that she needed to start but her partner had the machines with him.

The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation has been invested in purchasing a machine that allows you to do work that previously could not be performed.

So also has a full stock of machines to perform a wider variety of jobs, which should attract more number of customers.

Sonia thanked the Fundación Paraguaya for the credit granted and by which to get the opportunity to continue growing her business.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La profesora Gloria  de 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad los cuales estudian y trabaja, permitiendole incrementar sus ingresos y mantener mejores condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como docente en el Instituto Ruben Dario desde hace 30 años desempeñandose como maestra de secundaria, es una persona responsable que ha sabido aprovechar su trabajo para beneficiarse en su hogar, realizando mejoras al mismo.  

Solicita credito con el apoyo de kiva para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de excelente salud y tener estabilidad laboral .
texts.en:
Professor Gloria, 46, has three adult children who study and work which allows her to increase income and maintain the best possible living conditions.  She has worked as a Secondary School Teacher at the Rubén Darío Institute for the last 30 years.  She is a responsible person who has known how to take advantage of her work to benefit her home making improvements to it.

She is asking for Kiva financing to repair her kitchen.  Her greatest wish is that her family enjoys excellent health and to have steady employment.

loans.use: To repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a young man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Jameel started a small business in his house. He and his wife started cooking for parties, weddings etc.  Jameel's clients are expanding from the neighborhood to others in the refugee camp.

Jameel, who appears in the picture here, wants to answer the increasing demand and start saving for a small restaurant. He took a loan from FATEN to purchase cooking tools and larger amounts of ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase cooking tools and ingredients

loans.name: Laudelina

texts.en:
Laudelina G. is a 60 year old woman who runs a small bookstore and also sells clothing, underwear, shoes, etc. She has been in business for about 25 years. 

In the past, she owned several stores in different places, one of them in the market.  She doesn't have any family to help her with her business, which is the reason why she works extra carefully and passionately in every little thing she does with the ultimate goal of having impeccable customer service. 

The loan given by the foundation was used to buy different goods for her bookstore.  She took advantage of the situation that school is starting so the items will go fast, and the location of her store will also help her a lot (across the street from a school).  Ms. Laudelina thanks the given credit for which she is allowed to grow in terms of her business, thus she gets closer to her goals set as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying of different bookstore goods (paper, pens, etc.)

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel  de 50 años de edad,  trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 15 años en la Esc. Rigoberto cabeza de Nueva Guinea, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, todos trabajan  y han  formado su propio hogar pero siempre vive pendiente de ellos,en su centro de trabajo es reconocida como una maestra responsable, honesta y bien  trabajadora, es bien querida por sus alumnos , padres de familia y compañero de trabajo por ser una mujer con gran carisma.

Solicita  su 8vo crèdito para   comprar  materiales de contruccion para repellar una habitacion y combiar parte del techo de su vivienda, esta cliente esta muy agradecida con Kiva por el apoyo recibido y espera continuar siendo benficiada.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 50, has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for 15 years at Nueva Guinea’s Rigoberto Cabeza School.  She has four adult children who all work and have formed their own households.  However, she’s always watching over them.  She is recognized at work for being a responsible, honest and quite hard working teacher.  She is well liked by her students and coworkers for being someone with great charisma.

She is asking for her 8th loan to buy building materials and supplies to seal the walls in a bedroom and replace part of the roof on the house.  This client is very grateful to Kiva for the support received and hopes to continue to be so benefitted.

Her greatest dream is that her children continue to study so that they will become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: To seal walls and replace part of the roof.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee camp. She is a mother of one son and is married to Mahmoud N. who appears in the picture here. 
Tahreer and her husband run a small electronic goods store selling items such as bulbs, irons, hairdryers etc. Tahreer wants to enlarge the store, fixing the space that is not used by painting it and installing shelves to exhibit more goods as well as enrich the variety they sell. Tahreer took a loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Tahreer's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To expand, improve and fix the store (Painting)

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Urania es una joven de 30 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida quien es albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del hogas, habitantes de colonia  La union en nueva Guinea, ella  labora como docente de educacion primaria desde hace 13 años, la profesora Urania se ha destacado por ser una docente dedicada a su trabajo el cual desempeña con dedicacion y esmero.
Espera ser beneficiada de nuevo con Kiva en su 3er credito que esta solicitando para invertirlo en construir una habitacion con mejores condiciones como todo  cuidadano lo desea.  
Su mayor sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios y que su familia permanezca bien unida y con salud
texts.en:
Urania, 30, lives with her life partner who’s a Bricklayer and helps her with household expenses.  They live in Nueva Guinea’s La Unión neighborhood.   She has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for 13 years.  Teacher Urania has stood out for being a teacher who is devoted to her work which she does with dedication and commitment.

She hopes to be benefitted with another Kiva loan, her third, which she’s asking for to build a room with better conditions as every citizen wishes.

Her greatest dream is to complete her university studies and that her family stays together and healthy.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Saribel

texts.es:
Saribel  de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo en comarca Ceiba en Nueva Guinea, el trabaja como agricultor, explotando el terrenos con cultivos de reices y tuberculos, los cuales son comercializados; ayudando de esta manera con los gastos basicos del hogars, Saribel se desempeña  como docente de primaria en la Escuela Alfonso cortes desde hace 11 años, es una mujer dedicada y responsable, bien querida pos sus vecinos, compañeros de trabajos y alumnos, ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida con credito y esfuerzos propios.  

Espera ser beneficiada nuevamente con Kiva en este credito donde pretende continar con las mejoras de su casa, realizando anexos de techo de su casa.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que su familia no le falte lo basico en el hogar .
texts.en:
Saribel, 36, lives with her husband in Nueva Guinea’s Ceiba settlement.  He works as a Farmer growing roots and tubers to sell helping thus to meet basic household expenses.  Saribel has been working as an Elementary School Teacher at Alfonso Cortes School for the last 11 years.  She is a dedicated, responsible woman who is well liked by her neighbors, coworkers and students.  She’s been improving her living conditions with loans and through her own efforts.

She hopes to be a Kiva recipient again and use this loan to continue with home improvements, adding additional roofing to the house.

Her greatest dream in life is to have job stability and that her family has all the basics at home.

loans.use: To repair her roof.
